title: 1984 anti-Sikh riots: Death penalty for one convict; life imprisonment for another
keywords: India, India news, India news today, Today news, Google news, Breaking news, Yashpal Singh,Sikh men,Patiala court,naresh sehrawat,life sentence,Delhi court,1984 anti-Sikh riots
content: NEW DELHI: ADelhi courton Tuesday awarded death penalty to convictYashpal Singhfor his role in the1984 anti-Sikh riotsand sentenced another convict,Naresh Sehrawat, to life imprisonment.The verdict was pronounced inside Delhi's Tihar Jail due to security concerns and attack on the convicts on the premises of the Delhi court.Both the convicts were fined with Rs 35 lakh each by the court.Anti-Sikh riots case: Witness identifies Congress leader Sajjan KumarCham Kaur, who is being represented by senior advocate HS Phoolka, further testified that on November 1, 1984, when she had stepped out of the house, Kumar was addressing a crowd and instigating it against Sikhs.Thirty four years ago, two youngSikh menwere killed by a mob in Mahipalpur village in south Delhi. The two men who lost their lives on November 1, 1984, were Hardev Singh, who was then 24 years old, and Avtar Singh, 26.The home ministry had constituted a special investigating team (SIT) in 2015 to probe the 1984 riot cases. On November 14, the court had convicted Singh and Sherawat for killing two men - the first conviction in the cases reopened by the SIT.A first for SIT: Two convicted for 1984 killingsThirty four years after two young Sikh men were killed by a mob in Mahipalpur village in south Delhi, a Delhi court on Wednesday convicted two men for the murders, marking the first convictions secured by the SIT constituted by the home ministry in 2015 for probing 1984 riot cases.It was an eyewitness testimony that proved crucial in the conviction of the duo accused of killing two Sikh men during the 1984 riots in the national capital.Both accused were also convicted of dacoity, attempt to murder and other serious charges for they attacked the victims with a common intention and burnt their business establishments.

title: Dinu Solanki arrested in 2016 Kodinar riot case
keywords: Rajkot news, Rajkot latest news, Rajkot news live, Rajkot news today, Today news Rajkot, Rajkot CID,Dinu Solanki arrested in 2016 Kodinar riot case,criminal investigation department,Amit Jethwa
content: RAJKOT: Former BJP MP and prime accused in murder of RTI activistAmit Jethwa, Dinu Bogha Solanki was formally arrested by theRajkot CIDcrime on Saturday in connection with a 2016 rioting case registered in Kodinar town of Gir-Somnath district. Solanki was later released as he had obtained anticipatory bail from the local court. In 2016, a mob had ransacked one Rafiq Salot’s house and set it ablaze. Rafiq alleged that police omitted Solanki’s name in the FIR though he was allegedly present with the mob. Rafiq’s wife Jetunben filed a petition in high court demanding thorough probe into the incident and supplied video footage which showed presence of policemen at the crime scene. Based on the evidence, high court in 2017 directed CID crime to book Kodinar police inspector Abdjul Majid Nagori and his subordinate Praful Vadher for rioting and ordered fresh probe.After probe, CID booked Solanki and arrested him formally on Saturday. CID sources said that Solanki was allowed to go after interrogation. But he will have to appear in the court when the probe agency demands his remand. Investigating officer DySP D P Vaghela could not be contacted despite several attempt.

title: 2002 Gujarat riots: SC adjourns Zakia Jafri's plea till November 26
keywords: India, India news, India news today, Today news, Google news, Breaking news, Zakia Jafri plea,Zakia Jafri,Narendra Modi Gujarat Riots,Gujarat riots 2002 riots,Ehsan Jafri,2002 riots
content: NEW DELHI: The Supreme Court on Monday adjourned till November 26 hearing on appeal filed byZakia Jafri, wife of slain ex-Congress MP Ahshan Jafri, challenging the clean chit given to then Gujarat CM Narendra Modi by apex court constituted SIT in 2002 post-Godhra communal riots.Zakia, the wife ofEhsan Jafri, an ex-MP who was killed in one of the worst incidents during the riots, has challenged the Gujarat High Court's October 5, 2017, order rejecting her plea against the SIT's decision.Earlier, a bench of Justices AM Khanwilkar and Deepak Gupta said the matter will be heard on November 19, as the court has not gone through the petition in detail.During the brief hearing, senior advocate CU Singh, appearing for Jafri said notice needs to be issued in the plea as it pertains to the aspect of "larger conspiracy" during the period from February 27, 2002 and May 2002.The Supreme Court bench also noted the office report's remarks that the plea should be tagged along with the pending criminal appeals in the case.Senior advocate CS Vaidyanathan, appearing for Gujarat government, had opposed the suggestion and said that it is a separate case and should not be tagged along with the criminal appeals. The state government advocate also opposed issuing of a notice in the plea.On February 8, 2012, the SIT had filed a closure report, giving a clean chit to the then chief minister of Gujarat Narendra Modi and 63 others, including senior government officials, saying there was "no prosecutable evidence" against them.Ehsan Jafri was among 68 people who were killed at the Gulberg Society in Ahmedabad when a mob attacked it on February 28, 2002, a day after the S-6 Coach of the Sabarmati Express returning from Ayodhya at Godhra was burned, triggering the riots in Gujarat."The present Special Leave Petition is filed before this Court against the final judgement and order dated October 5, 2017 passed by the High Court of Gujarat...which erroneously upheld the order of the magistrate accepting the closure report filed by the Special Investigative Agency appointed by this Court concerning the violence in Gujarat in 2002," said the plea of Zakia filed through advocate Aparna Bhat.Zakia sought an interim order to the SIT to carry out further investigation with regard to her complaint and the evidence provided by her before the magistrate through the protest petition.The high court in its October 5, 2017, order had said that the SIT probe was monitored by the Supreme Court but had partly allowed Zakia's petition as far as its demand of a further investigation was concerned.It had said that petitioner can approach an appropriate forum including the magistrate's court, a division bench of the high court or the Supreme Court seeking further investigation.Activist Teesta Setalvad, secretary of NGO - Citizen for Justice and Peace- is also a co-petitioner in the appeal seeking reversal of the Gujarat high court order.

title: Laugh riots tickle funny bones
keywords: City News,City Latest News, News, Times Of India, Latest news
content: Coimbatore: Witty one-liners and satirical gestures sparked laughter at Laughathon 2018 organized by the Humour Society Coimbatore in association with The Times of India at Le Meridien on Sunday.The show was kick-started by city-based satirist Dr G Lakshmipathi. The hall, filled with over 500 guests, cracked up as the stand-up comedians tickled the funny bones with their sharp satirical takes and amusing expressions.Stand-up comedian Avinash Agarwal spoke about how Lakshmipathi, despite being a doctor by profession, manages to attract crowds in his unique way. Explaining how dark his childhood was, even though he was as fair as milk, Agarwal pointed at a fair Italian woman among the audience and said, “We have another Italian lady here and we hope, you don't have a genius child as hers.”Actor, comedian and writer Vamsidhar Bhogaraju later took the stage and caste a spell on the audience. His tales were personal and revolved around his life. He spoke about how his marriage ceremony was different from western marriages. “My marriage was held at 2am, when I wanted to sleep instead of getting married,” he said with amusing body language, as the audience roared with laughter. He imitated the recorded voices of telecom companies like BSNL and Vodafone, and the railway.Bhargav Ramakrishnan aka Baggy also joined the bandwagon of performers and kept the comic momentum going on by cracking jokes on the social system. “Everyone who studied engineering are not engineers,” he said as he made satirical comments about aging. “When you are in your 20s, you will hope on to bars and make impressive dances and make instant night trips but when you are in your 30s, everything will change.”Vaibhav Sethia, another comedian, steered jokes about the society and shared a bunch of stories from everyday life.

title: Anti-Sikh riots case: Witness identifies Congress leader Sajjan Kumar
keywords: Delhi news, Delhi latest news, Delhi news live, Delhi news today, Today news Delhi, witness,Sajjan Kumar,Indira Gandhi,anti-sikh riots,1984 anti-Sikh riots,1984
content: NEW DELHI: A witness in the 1984anti-Sikh riotscase on Friday identified Congress leaderSajjan Kumarin connection with the case.According to Cham Kaur’s statement, recorded before District and Sessions Judge Poonam A Bamba, her family had watched the news of Indira Gandhi’s assassination on October 31,1984on TV. Kaur, who is being represented by senior advocate HS Phoolka, further testified that on November 1, 1984, when she had stepped out of the house, Kumar was addressing a crowd and instigating it against Sikhs. Her testimony also showed that on November 2, 1984, her son and father, were badly thrashed after being pulled out of their place of hiding.Kumar and others are accused in the case pertaining to violence against Sikhs that gripped the national capital.

title: Gear up for a laugh riot this weekend
keywords: Coimbatore news, Coimbatore latest news, Coimbatore news live, Coimbatore news today, Today news Coimbatore, Vamsidhar Bhograju,Vaibhav Sethia,Dr G Lakshmipathi,bhargav ramakrishnan,Avinash Agarwal
content: This weekend, get set to laugh out loud as some of the ace comedians in the country are all set to tickle your funny bones at the annual comedy fest Laughathon. Standup comediansVaibhav Sethia,Avinash Agarwal,Bhargav Ramakrishnanaka Baggy and Vamsidhar Bhograj will be at the helm of affairs as they take the audience through a journey of humor, spontaneity and rib-tickling riot. With city-based satiristDr G Lakshmipathikick-starting the evening, there will be a heavy dose of humour.Avinash Agarwal tells us, “I had performed in Coimbatore few months ago for the Coimbatore Humour Society Trust and I found out that people here are extremely happy. But, rich people aren’t supposed to be happy. I want to find out what exactly is keeping them so cheerful. Most of my jokes will be connected to day-to-day mundane affairs like family and traffic. I will be doing some observational humour.”Chennai boy Baggy will dole out some self-depreciating humour along with his other jokes. “There will be lot of audience interaction. I have heard that the audience here is hungry for some good comedy.” Those seated in the front rows, get ready to be trolled.While Vaibhav Sethia will steer clear of jokes on politics, religion or society, he will have a bunch of stories from everyday life. “I will be performing by show Onto Something. There will be some true-ish stories, mixed with ridicules. I keep my comedy as generic as possible so that all kinds of audience can relate to it. There won’t be much audience interaction in my show as I feel that those in the back rows can get disconnected.”Actor, comedian and writer Vamsidhar Bhogaraju from Bengaluru will have the audience eating out his hands with his jokes. “My standup comedy is personal and mostly revolves around things that happened in my life. The Coimbatore audience is quite mature and they laugh at the right jokes. It would be interesting to perform for them.”Humour Society Coimbatore in association with The Times of India is organizing Laughathon 2018 on November 18 at 6 pm at Le Meridien, Avinashi Road, Coimbatore

title: 1984 riots: Sajjan Kumar instigated mob to kill Sikhs, victim tells court
keywords: India, India news, India news today, Today news, Google news, Breaking news, Sikhs,Sajjan Kumar,Indira Gandhi,demise of Indira Gandhi,1984 anti-Sikh riots
content: NEW DELHI: A key prosecution witness in a1984 anti-Sikh riotscase Friday identified Congress leaderSajjan Kumarbefore a Delhi court as one who had allegedly instigated the mob to killSikhs.Deposing as a prosecution witness, Cham Kaur told the court that she had seen Kumar allegedly addressing the crowd in national capital's Sultanpuri area in 1984 that Sikhs had killed "our mother" and instigated the mob to kill them."On October 31, 1984 we were watching TV on the demise ofIndira Gandhi. On November 1, 1984 when I stepped out to look for my goat, I saw accused Sajjan Kumar addressing the crowd and was saying 'hamari ma maar di. Sardaro ko maar do' (killed our mother. Kill the Sikhs)," Kaur told District Judge Poonam A Bamba.She further said that the next morning, they were attacked in which here son and her father were killed."My son Kapoor Singh and my father Sardarji Singh were pulled out of the hiding place on second floor, beaten badly and were thrown down from the roof," she said, adding that she herself received injuries in the attack.During the proceedings, Kaur also identified Kumar, who was present in the court."I could recognise the accused Sajjan Kumar, as we used to visit him for getting help in making ration card, passport. We used to visit the accused for getting the papers stamps as he was the MP/MLA," she said.She further named other persons who were shot dead on the same date by the mob. The injured and the family members of victims were taken to the police station and relief camps by police and army respectively. She told the court that she had named Kumar earlier also.Before Kaur, another key prosecution witness Sheela Kaur had identified Kumar as the one who had instigated the mob in Sultanpuri.The case was transferred from Karkardooma court to Patiala House court here by the Delhi High Court, which had directed the district judge to video record the proceedings at the cost of the accused.Kumar and two other accused, Brahmanand Gupta and Ved Prakash, had said that they were ready to bear the expenses of the videography of proceedings.The three accused are facing trial on charges of murder and rioting in the case pertaining to killing of Surjit Singh in Sultanpuri.The proceedings in the case were earlier stayed after the victim and complainant Joginder Singh approached the high court seeking transfer of the case while alleging that evidence was not being properly recorded.

title: 1984 riots: Death sought for two convicted of murder
keywords: Delhi news, Delhi latest news, Delhi news live, Delhi news today, Today news Delhi, riots,Murder,Indira Gandhi,death,convicts,1984 anti-Sikh riots,1984
content: NEW DELHI: The state on Thursday sought death penalty for the two men convicted ofmurderand other heinous charges in a1984anti-Sikhriotscase. The prosecution submitted before the court that the killings were premeditated and part of a genocide against the Sikhs.Asserting that it was a “rarest of rare” case where the victims have been deprived of justice for 34 years, public prosecutor S K Kain and SIT lawyer Surinder Mohit Singh urged additional sessions judge Ajay Pandey to award capital punishment. The defence, on the other hand, asked the court for leniency. The fate of theconvictsnow hangs on the sentencing on November 20.The two men who were killed in communal frenzy on November 1, 1984, were Hardev Singh, who was 24-years-old, and Avtar Singh, who was 26. The court convicted two men for the killings, making it the first conviction secured by the SIT constituted by the Centre in 2015 to probe the 1984 riot cases.Kain submitted that the convicted men—Naresh Sehrawat and Yashpal Singh—had caused the “brutal” murders and wounded three others. “They brought kerosene, sticks, stones, etc. This case falls within the aggravating circumstances as it has been committed after planning that involved extreme cruelty,” the prosecution argued.The prosecution also submitted that the crime exhibited “exceptional depravity”. “Thousands of innocent people were murdered and their properties were looted in Delhi. These incidents affected the society at large. Only the Sikh community was targeted,” the prosecutor said.Defence counsel O P Sharma asked for leniency and argued that the attack was not planned but happened in a flare-up. But the prosecution argued that it was premeditated as it happened a day after then Prime Minister Indira Gandhi’s assassination on October 31, 1984.Sangat Singh, brother of Hardev Singh, had testified that a Congress leader and Sehrawat were leading the mob, exhorting it to kill Sikhs. He had said that when the mob moved towards them, he and Hardev ran to take refuge in the room of one Surjeet Singh who later became an eyewitness.

title: Missing papers, untraceable witnesses: SIT’s biggest enemy was time in 1984 riots
keywords: Delhi news, Delhi latest news, Delhi news live, Delhi news today, Today news Delhi, SIT,Sikh,Sajjan Kumar,riot,Mehrauli,Indira,convicted,Accused,1984
content: NEW DELHI: The special investigation team, whose inquiry findings led to the conviction of two men in the anti-Sikh riots of1984, was formed after the Union home minister ordered it on February 12, 2015. TheSIT, comprising an IPS officer, a retired judge and a DANIPS officer, had the almost impossible task of conducting a fresh probe into all cases relating to the riots.Over the passage of 30 years, some complainants and witnesses had moved out from their original colonies, while others had died. Even the policemen who had originally handled the cases had retired or left Delhi. Theriotsites too had undergone changes since.However, the SIT, assisted by a team of around 50 cops, started a systematic effort to join the dots. Led by IPS officer Anurag Kumar, DANIPS officer Kumar Gyanesh and justice Rakesh Kapoor, the SIT was notified as a police station with jurisdiction over entire Delhi. Immediately after its constitution, it issued advertisements requesting riot victims to once again report their cases. The panel members scanned through 650 cases, sorting out 280 which were unresolved.In most of the cases, the witnesses or theaccusedwere no longer alive. Documents related to some medico-legal cases and autopsies were discovered to be missing, but if found damaged, were retrieved with the help of conservation experts. In some cases, victims had kept documentary records secure along with photographic evidence.Enquiring into a case registered atMehraulipolice station, the SIT realised that a politician had been acquitted despite a chargesheet filed against him in 1985. The FIR named Surjeet Singh, Sangat Singh and Kuldeep Singh as witnesses in the case. The cops contacted Sangat Singh, who now lives in Jalandhar, and recorded his statement. He also assisted police in contacting the others.The SIT discovered that though the politician was named in the FIR, it was his associates Naresh Sehrawat and Yashpal Singh who murdered Sangat’s family members during the riots. The two men led a thousand-strong mob in Mahipalpur village and burnt down the grocery shop of Hardev Singh, Sangat’s brother. Hardev, brother Kuldeep and cousin Avtar Singh took shelter with their neighbour Surjeet Singh. The mob detected them there, and SIT said Sehrawat poured kerosene on Surjeet’s belongings and set his house on fire.According to the investigation, the rioters used Surjeet’s kirpan to stab him, Hardev, Avtar, Sangat and Kuldeep. Before ransacking the house, they threw the injured men off the first floor terrace. The five were admitted to Safdarjung Hospital, where Hardev and Avtar died. After recovery, some family members shifted to Punjab, others went overseas. The cops contacted a relative, Ratan Singh, who had identified the bodies, and the Italy resident agreed to depose. He recorded his statement in September last year. Both Sehrawat and Yashpal Singh were chargesheeted based on his statement.The investigative team filed the chargesheet on January 31. During the trial, 18 prosecution witnesses were examined. On October 31 last year, charges for one of the cases registered in Mehrauli were framed after final arguments.The SIT is now probing three cases registered in Janakpuri, Vikaspuri and Saraswati Vihar, all of which name Congress leaderSajjan Kumaras the accused. Kumar has been questioned five times in the past three years. Some of the witnesses now staying in the US are being examined before chargesheets are framed in the cases. Three others cases are pending investigation. The SIT has also transferred a case that was being probed by CBI.

title: Ladoo movie review highlights: A laughing riot over a mess
keywords: Vinay Forrt New,Vinay Forrt film,Vinay Forrt,Ladoo movie review highlights:,Ladoo First Half
content: When a film has Shabareesh Varma,Vinay Forrtand Balu Varghese in the lead the comedy is expected in the mix. And Laddoo is definitely a comedy. But will it be yet another BTech/ unemployed youngsters getting into trouble story, that is seen as the theme of this generation?Helmed by debutante Arun K David, Ladoo is a comedy written by Sagar Satyan. It is definitely a comedy by and for youngsters. In a way, it is also sort of a tribute to the yesteryear comedies of the 80s and 90s that the millinials grew up watching. Sabareesh Varma also pens the lyrics to the song by Rajesh Murugesan. Adding colour to the young and vibrant visuals Gautham Sankar works the camera for Laddoo.Vinu and Angeline, a couple in love, wish to elope and get married. But then, when friends step in to help, it becomes a clear case of 'too many cooks spoil the broth'. With each turn going wrong it seems like there is more at stake than meets the eye.Much like the early 90s movie, Ladoo is the story of a mess that creates itself, thanks to the idiocies of too many, and then struggles to untangle the mess one by one. With debutants cooking this 'Laddoo', the film is a fun ride drenched in comedy. A love story, and a planned eloping and a chase- the story is as old as time, but what makes it different is the young and fresh narrative style. Everything from the songs stand out as stylish. Laddoo stands out in the making and it's obvious tribute to cinematic motifs of the 90s.How will they save the day? How will the tangled mess get sorted? Will love win over or is the story all that simple? Find out, laughing your lungs out throughout the way.

title: Pilot's mistake sets off Kandahar hijack alarm at Delhi airport
keywords: Delhi news, Delhi latest news, Delhi news live, Delhi news today, Today news Delhi, Sikh,Sajjan,riots,relief,Kandahar hijack alarm at Delhi airport,Indira Gandhi International Airport,granted,Ariana Afghan Airlines,Air Traffic Control
content: NEW DELHI: A hijack alert sent by mistake sent security teams at Delhi airport into a tizzy on Saturday afternoon and evoking memories of the hijacking of an Indian Airlines flight to Kandahar in 1999. The captain of an Afghan airliner, headed to Kandahar, sent a hijack alert toair traffic control, which activated an emergency response.The Airbus A-310 with 124 passengers (including an infant) and nine crew members was asked to immediately stop from proceeding for take-off to Kandahar and instead told to taxi to an isolation bay at the airport. Once docked, it was surrounded by CISF and other security personnel.This is when the pilot told the security team that he had sent the message by mistake. Not willing to take any chances, CISF sanitised the aircraft and frisked all on board. TheAriana Afghan Airlinescommander, it emerged, was briefing his co-pilot about the protocol in the event of a hijack. CISF and the Bureau of Civil Aviation Security said the captain pressed the hijack button by mistake.1999 lesson learnt well, says senior pilotThe flight’s captain, Rokai Naimi, submitted a written note saying: “Today our staff in Delhi informed us that there are plans of hijacking aircraft. In cockpit, I briefed my first officer… Regarding this code we should be careful… But it was too late, the Delhi ATC got it… It happened while briefing. It is not true (sic).”Once cleared by security, flight FG-312 took off from Delhi at 5.41pm, a little more than two hours behind schedule. BCAS chief Kumar Rajesh Chandra said: “The captain said his airline staff in Delhi had informed him about plans to hijack the plane. He committed the mistake of inadvertently pressing the hijack button.”A senior pilot, who had watched the Indian Airlines' Kandahar hijack in December 1999 from close quarters, said: “While what happened on Saturday was a mistake, it was good see that the plane was not allowed to take off and asked to taxi to a parking bay.”

title: ‘It’s incorrect to say riots fallout of a conspiracy’
keywords: Pune news, Pune latest news, Pune news live, Pune news today, Today news Pune, Tukaram,Sena dynasty,Sambhaji,Hindutva,Chhatrapati,Adivasi
content: PUNE: Vadhu Budruk resident Sharad K Dabhade on Monday denied that the riots at his village on December 29, 2017, and at Koregaon Bhima on January 1, 2018, were the fallout of an alleged conspiracy by (Hindutvaleaders) Milind Ekbote andSambhajiBhide Guruji.In his cross-examination before the Koregaon Bhima inquiry commission, Dabhade said it was not correct to say that he and his friends participated in the alleged conspiracy from the stage of planning till the execution. The witness’s examination in chief was conducted at the previous round of hearing in Pune on October 5.Senior lawyer B G Bansode conducted the cross-examination on behalf of Thane residentTukaramGaware, whose vehicle was torched during the clashes at Koregaon Bhima. He focused on establishing a link between Dabhade and his friends, and Ekbote, Bhide Guruji and Hindu Rashtra Sena chief Dhananjay Desai, among others.Bansode furnished a slew of photographs (featuring pictures of Dabhade and his friends with these leaders); messages circulated on a WhatsApp group involving Dabhade as a member; and pamphlets and slogans published and distributed ahead of January 1, calling upon a particular class (Hindus) to gather against the Dalits. Bansode suggested that because of these messages, the persons, including Dabhade, responded to the call and participated in the riots. Dabhade maintained, “It is not correct.”Dabhade initially insisted that the photographs furnished by Bansode were “morphed”, but later conceded that the same carried his pictures although he had no knowledge about who published and distributed the same. Bansode also crossed the witness on the December 29, 2017 events at Vadhu Budruk to suggest that a bigger mob of nearly 1,000 people had gathered there as a part of a pre-planned activity against the Dalit community. Dabhade denied it, saying, “I do not know.”Dabhade was among the eight people arrested on December 29, 2017 in relation to a case registered under the SC/ST (Prevention of Atrocities) Act following the Vadhu Budruk incident. He was released from jail on January 7, 2018.He told the commission that he had no knowledge about the history behind the January 1 incident and that, he was not in a position to say whether or not to support the slogan “Ek Hindu, Lakh Hindu” calling for Hindus to unite at Vadhu Budruk to counter the attempt to spread distorted history aboutChhatrapatiSambhaji Maharaj.Dabhade replied in the negative to the suggestions that he was known as “Hindushree Sharad Dabhade” and “Sarkar” in his village and said he had heard about Sambhaji Bhide and Shree Shivpratishthan Hindusthan. On the events of December 29, 2017, Dabhade mostly said “I do not know” and “it is not correct” to the question phrased by Bansode, suggesting destruction of Govind Gopal’s samadhi as a part of a pre-planned conspiracy.

title: Muzaffarnagar riots accused found dead in his home
keywords: Lucknow news, Lucknow latest news, Lucknow news live, Lucknow news today, Today news Lucknow, Ram Das,Muzaffarnagar riots,muzaffarnagar,Kutba village,kala
content: MUZAFFARNAGAR: An accused in the 2013Muzaffarnagar riotswas found dead in his home inKutba villagehere, police said on Saturday. The body ofRam DasaliasKala(30), bearing a bullet injury, was sent for a post-mortem examination, they said, adding that the matter was being probed.Police are yet to ascertain whether Das committed suicide or was murdered.Meanwhile, security was beefed up in and around the communally sensitive village where eight people had reportedly died and several left injured during the 2013 riots.Extra police personnel were deployed as a precautionary measure to prevent any untoward incident, officials said.The communal clashes in Muzaffarnagar and adjoining areas in August and September 2013 had claimed more than 60 lives while over 40,000 people were displaced.

title: Eerie silence near homes of 2 convicted after 34 years
keywords: Delhi news, Delhi latest news, Delhi news live, Delhi news today, Today news Delhi, SIT,Sikh,riot,Indira,convicted,Accused,1984
content: NEW DELHI: Suresh Sehrawat was in a solemn mood outside his hotel in south Delhi’s Mahipalpur on Wednesday. He held a copy of the court order convicting his elder brother, Naresh Sehrawat, of killing two men and injuring three others during the1984anti-Sikh riots.In the presence of the younger members of his family, Suresh refused to say much except that his brother was innocent and had been framed in the case. “We don’t want to talk about it. Such talking had led to my brother getting framed and arrested for no reason,” said Suresh. “He is now an ailing, aged man, but has been taken to jail.” He then went back into his hotel to pore through the court order once again.The family managed to keep the news about Naresh’s conviction to themselves, and the local residents appeared not to be aware, or feigned ignorance. One of them, requesting anonymity, said, “The family is well off and runs a chain of hotels and has properties on the highway. Naresh used to work at the local post office but earned enough to invest profitably after some of his property was acquired for the IGI Airport revamp project.”The Sehrawats’ neighbour, Yashpal Singh, was alsoconvictedin the same case. Singh’s family too refused to comment on the day’s developments. Singh had sold some property around two decades ago and used the money to construct two hotels on the Mahipalpur main road facing the national highway.A friend of Naresh’s father, Devi Ram, confided that both the convicted men were associated with a political leader at the time of the riots. “I don’t know if they participated in the riots, but both were supporting the ruling party then,” Ram claimed. “Congress leaders used to visit their home for family functions.” He added, “Naresh is a good man, but may have supported the rioters for financial gains.”

title: 4 booked for murdering Muzaffarnagar riots accused
keywords: Meerut news, Meerut latest news, Meerut news live, Meerut news today, Today news Meerut, Uttar Pradesh,Muzaffarnagar riots accused murder,Muzaffarnagar riots accused,Muzaffarnagar riots,muzaffarnagar
content: MUZAFFARNAGAR: Four unidentified persons were on Sunday booked for the alleged murder of a 2013Muzaffarnagar riots accused, police said.The body of Ram Das alias Kala (30), bearing a bullet injury, was found from his home in Kutba village here.Circle officer (CO) Hariram Yadav said the police registered a case after a complaint was filed by the victim's brother, Sanjiv who alleged that the four assailants had come on motorcycles and shot his brother.Meanwhile, security was beefed up in and around the communally sensitive village where eight people had reportedly died and several left injured during the 2013 riots.Extra police personnel were deployed as a precautionary measure to prevent any untoward incident, officials said.The communal clashes in Muzaffarnagar and adjoining areas in August and September 2013 had claimed more than 60 lives while over 40,000 people were displaced.

title: Pakistan arrests 250 for rioting, disrupting peace
keywords: Pakistan,Multan,corporal,blasphemy law in Pakistan,Asia Bibi blasphemy case
content: ISLAMABAD/ LAHORE:Pakistanpolice on Sunday arrested nearly 250 people from across the country on charges of arson, vandalism and violence during the three-day mass protests following the acquittal of Christian woman Asia Bibi.A day after striking a deal with the radical Islamist party Tehreek-e-Labbaik Pakistan (TLP), the government swung into action as it started a crackdown against the people who vandalised public properties during the protests.Asia Bibi, a 47-year-old mother of four, was convicted in 2010 after being accused of insulting Islam in a row with her neighbours. She always maintained her innocence, but has spent most of the past eight years in solitary confinement.In a landmark judgement last Wednesday, a three-judge bench of the Supreme Court headed by Chief Justice Saqib Nisar overturned the conviction of Aasia Bibi facing execution for blasphemy, sparking protests led by the TLP and other groups across Pakistan.The protestors led by the TLP and other groups blocked major highways and roads in different parts of the country.The interior ministry has initiated criminal proceedings against the rioters and booked 5,000 people, including TLP chief Khadim Hussain Rizvi and senior leader Afzal Qadri, on charges of rioting and disrupting peace during the demonstrationsIn Lahore, the police registered 11 cases against 1,500 persons, including the TLP leaders for blocking roads and creating law and order situation. The FIRs against Qadri and Rizvi have been sealed, The Express Tribune reported.In Faisalabad, the police registered 29 cases against 3,000 protestors and arrested 218 persons.In Chiniot, 3 cases were registered and 13 persons were arrested; in Sargodha 2 cases were registered against 300 persons and in Jhang two cases were registered against 150 persons. Twelve of these people were arrested, the report said.In Okara, FIR was registered against 200 people. Twenty people later got bails and released. The Rawalpindi police also registered 18 cases against hundreds of TLP workers while 16 workers were released on Saturday.In Islamabad, two cases were registered against more than 100 accused, including 20 workers of a religious party. In Karachi's Gulistan-e-Jauhar and Pehlwan Goth areas, three persons were arrested for firing and forcing people to shut down their businesses.Prime Minister Imran Khan, who is currently on an official trip to China, reportedly expressed his anger over damage to public and private properties during the three-day-long protests.Khan ordered the arrest of the people who were engaged in vandalism and directed the federal government to work in collaboration with the provincial governments, the report added.

title: 400 Bihar trainee cops run riot, try to lynch senior
keywords: Patna news, Patna latest news, Patna news live, Patna news today, Today news Patna, Trainee cops,Nitish Kumar,Lady Cop,dengue fever,constable's death,constable,Bihar
content: PATNA: Several police personnel were beaten up, the entire police line here vandalised and a few rounds of fire opened on Friday as trainee constables went berserk over the death of a womanconstablefrom dengue. As the news of the death reached the police line, trainee constables smashed furniture and threw stones at seniors who came in sight.Vehicles, including those belonging to officers, were damaged and overturned as two officers of SP rank and a Sergeant Major-cum-DSP became special target of their ire while some media personnel were also beaten up.Senior Superintendent of Police Manu Maharaj, donning riot gear, was dissuaded by juniors from entering the police line as the situation was on the boil. He later entered the police line while jawans of the STF, ATS andBiharMilitary Police were summoned to bring the situation under control.After an hour-long disturbance, DIG, Patna Range, Rajesh Kumar said the situation was now under control.Chief MinisterNitish Kumarhas sought a detailed report on the incident from Director General of Police K S Dwivedi.Dwivedi told a news channel over phone that the trouble-makers had hardly undergone training for a few days. They were not yet familiar with police work culture and discipline, he added.Attempts would be made to reform them but those who had indulged in violent acts will be punished. It was also evident that they were instigated by some others. They would be identified during inquiry and stern action would be taken against them, the DGP said.As to the allegation that the deceased constable had been refused leave, he said she died while undergoing treatment for dengue in a hospital and so any refusal of leave was not the reason for her death.Former Bihar Chief Minister Jitan Ram Manjhi, while reacting to the incident, said Nitish Kumar has lost control over the law and order machinery. title: SAD takes out protest march to seek justice for 1984 anti-Sikh riots victims
keywords: India, India news, India news today, Today news, Google news, Breaking news, Sukhbir Singh Badal,Sikh,shiromani akali dal,Indira Gandhi,Harsimrat Kaur Badal,1984 anti-Sikh riots
content: NEW DELHI: TheShiromani Akali Dal(SAD) on Saturday took out a protest march to seek justice for the families of those killed in the1984 anti-Sikh riots.The march, led by SAD presidentSukhbir Singh Badaland Union ministerHarsimrat Kaur Badal, started from Gurudwara Pratapganj and ended outside Parliament Street police station.The Akali Dal has been seeking justice for the victims of the 1984 anti-Sikh riots in which a large number of Sikhs were killed in the national capital and in other parts of the country in the aftermath of former prime ministerIndira Gandhi's assassination by her Sikh bodyguards.

title: 400 Bihar trainee cops run riot, try to lynch senior
keywords: Patna news, Patna latest news, Patna news live, Patna news today, Today news Patna, patna vioelnce,patna trainee police,patna savita,Patna Police Lines,Patna Police,patna
content: PATNA: In a virtual revolt against senior officers on Friday, around 400 trainee constables, most of them women, went on the rampage in and outside the Police Lines here for more than four hours over the death of a colleague, Savita Pathak (22). Savita was suffering from dengue and was allegedly denied leave.Not only did the trainees try to lynch DSP Mohammad Mashluddin for denying leave to Savita, they also manhandled Rural SP, City SPs ofPatnacentral and east, and several DSPs when they reached there to pacify them.Several police officers up to DSP rank were injured in the violence on the premises at Lodipur under the Buddha Colony police station. The trainees were so furious that even SSP Manu Maharaaj could not enter the premises for over 40 minutes around 12.The trainees alleged that Savita had been suffering from high fever for the last three days but despite that the DSP did not grant her leave. On top of it, he forced her to perform traffic duty near Kargil Chowk.Savita was taken to a private hospital on Wednesday morning but she died there within a few hours. Chief minister Nitish Kumar has sought a report from DGP KS Dwivedi on the unprecedented incident within three days.The DGP, who was in Delhi, told a TV channel that the young recruits were yet to be trained and they might have been provoked by someone to protest over their colleague’s death in an indisciplined and violent manner. The DGP has asked DIG (central range) Rajesh Kumar to probe the violence.As soon as the violence began, the situation turned serious. The bodyguards of senior police officers fired at least four rounds in the air to keep the trainees at bay. All this while, the trainees kept on smashing police vehicles parked on the premises. They also ransacked the office and residence of the sergeant major. Later, they came out of the complex and indulged in acts of vandalism, damaging vehicles and shops in the area.When they damaged a CCTV camera installed at a nearby temple and tried to take away its hard drive to destroy the evidence, the locals started throwing stones and bricks at them. The trainees then retreated to the Police Lines and hurled stones and bricks at the locals in retaliation. At least 10 people were injured in the attack. Some media persons were also hurt.Mashluddin’s mother Haruna Khatoon, wife Anjum Ara and 20-year-old daughter Amrin Ajeen were also manhandled. His wife told TOI that the trainees barged into their residence while chasing the DSP. “We stood at the door leading to the room where he was hiding. I told them they would have to kill all of us before entering the room,” Anjum said. “Mashluddin is in hospital and his condition is serious,” she added.

title: 2002 Gujarat riots: SC to hear on Nov 19 Zakia Jafri's plea against SIT clean chit to PM Modi, others
keywords: India, India news, India news today, Today news, Google news, Breaking news, Zakia Jafri,PM Modi,Narendra Modi,Gujarat Riots,Ehsan Jafri
content: NEW DELHI: The Supreme Court will hear on November 19 the petition filed byZakia Jafrichallenging the clean chit given by the Special Investigating Team (SIT) to Prime MinisterNarendra Modiin connection with the 2002 post-Godhra riots in Gujarat when he was the chief minister.Zakia, the wife ofEhsan Jafri, an ex-MP who was killed in one of the worst incidents during the riots, has also challenged the Gujarat High Court's October 5, 2017 order rejecting her plea against the SIT's decision.The Supreme Court bench comprising Justices A M Khanwilkar and Deepak Gupta also said the matter will be heard on November 19 as the bench has not gone through the petition in detail.The SIT had, on February 8, 2012, filed a closure report and given the clean chit to Modi saying there was no prosecutable evidence against him.

title: Girls who complained of abuse by officials booked for 'rioting'
keywords: Agra news, Agra latest news, Agra news live, Agra news today, Today news Agra, Section 320 of the Indian Penal Code,B. R. Ambedkar,assistant superintendent,Agra University,agra
content: AGRA: A day after clashes broke out between students’ of Dr Bhimrao Ambedkar University and its officials, leaving five staffers seriously injured, two girl pupils were booked for ‘rioting’ on Friday. Both girls had moved a complaint against varsity registrar K N Singh and its chief proctor Manoj Srivastava, accusing them of verbal and physical abuse.Station house officer (SHO) of Hariparwat police station, Mahesh Chand Gautam, said, “The complaint filed by the girls was found to be false. Hence, no case has been registered against registrar Singh and proctor Srivastava. They have been booked under IPC sections 147 (punishment for riots), 149 (Every member of unlawful assembly guilty of offence committed in prosecution of common object), 323 (Punishment for voluntarily causing hurt), 325 (punishment for voluntarily causing grievous hurt), 336 (act endangering life or personal safety of others) and 504 (intentional insult with intent to provoke breach of the peace).”Assistant superintendentof police (ASP), Abhishek (who goes by his first name), said, “I am yet to come across the complaint that has been filed by the girls against varsity officials. We will investigate the matter.”The girls, both 20-year-old, alleged that were made to sit at the Hariparwat police station till late in the evening on Thursday even as police refused to register an FIR against Singh and Srivastava. They are students of a self-financed college in Mathura. In their complaint, the girls have said that they were verbally abused and molested by the varsity officials.“The registrar and proctor locked us in a room and abused us. We were later handed over to police. We had told the cops about the officials’ misbehavior but they did not listen to us. No FIR was registered either even though we gave a written complaint against the varsity officials,” said one of the girls, a judo player.“Police have been supporting the university administration. They booked us under serious charges after we complained of physical abuse by the officials,” said the other girl, who is a hockey player.

title: 12 cops suspended for remaining absent during Mahuva rioting
keywords: Rajkot news, Rajkot latest news, Rajkot news live, Rajkot news today, Today news Rajkot, navratri,Malcolm Reynolds,Mahuva, Bhavnagar,Botad district,Bhavnagar,Amreli district
content: RAJKOT:Bhavnagarsuperintendent of police (SP) Pravin Mall cracked whip on 12 policemen for remaining absent from assigned duty in Mahuva where rioting broke out after local VHP leader’s murder last week.Mal suspended the12 constables and also recommended Amreli SP and Botad SP to take the action against their staff who were deputed in Mahuva but remained absent.Talking to TOI, Mal said: “Bandobast was made in wake of communal tension and lives of many people were at stake. It is a very serious matter that these policemen remained absent from the duty during rioting and clashes between two communities and the situation was tense.”Seven constables ofAmreli districtand two of Botad remained absent. Mal also wrote a letter to the home guard commandant in Bhavnagar to take action against 10 jawans for remaining absent from assigned duty.Mahuva VHP president Jayesh Gujaria was stabbed to death on the night of October 23 by four persons from minority community. The murder was a fall-out of the fight between Gujaria and prime accused Bapudi duringNavratri. After mourning meeting of the slain leader late on Thursday, mobs vandalized and set ablaze five shops, a motorcycle and resorted to stone pelting. Police had to lob 19 teargas shells bring the situation under control.

title: Mahuva tense, mobs torch five shops; 35 held for rioting
keywords: Rajkot news, Rajkot latest news, Rajkot news live, Rajkot news today, Today news Rajkot, torch,station inspector,rioting,mobs,Mahuva, Bhavnagar
content: RAJKOT: Mahuva town in Bhavnagar district remained on the edge asmobswent on a rampage after the mourning meeting organized for slain Vishwa Hindu Parishad (VHP) taluka president Jayesh Gujaria late on Thursday.Police had to lob 19 tear gas shells to bring the situation under control after the mob set ablaze five shops, one motorcycle and resorted to stone pelting. Considering the volatility of the situation, Bhavnagar district collector Harshad Patel has imposed a ban on internet in Mahuva town for five days beginning Thursday night.Gujaria, 22, was stabbed to death on the night of October 23 by four persons from the minority community over a fight during Navratri.“After the mourning meeting, mobs went on a rampage and resorted to violence. We had to lob 19 tear gas shells to disperse the mob,” said Mahuva policestation inspectorS N Barot. Police arrested 35 rioters and hunt is on for others.Bhavnagar superintendent of police (SP) Pravin Mal told TOI that 10 offences ofriotinghave been registered in Mahuva police station and 35 rioters have been arrested. Two companies of SRP have been deployed in the town in wake of violence.On Friday too, shops in the coastal town’s main market downed their shutters over fear of rioting.Gujaria (22), a resident of Tulsi Society in Mahuva was recently appointed as the president of Mahuva taluka VHP. was waylaid by the accused, identified as Bapudi, Aslam, Imran and their unidentified associate, who attacked him and his friend Mahesh Majithia (23) with knives and iron pipes. The victims were sitting and chatting in Gandhi Chowk, when the accused arrived at the spot on two bikes. They launched repeatedly stabbed Gujaria who later died before reaching a private hospital.Investigation has revealed that during the recently held Navratri festival, Gujaria and Bapudi had an altercation over the issue of putting up VHP hoardings. Both of them hurled abuses at each other and issued threats. Nursing a grudge against Gujaria, Bapudi and his aides attacked him.On October 23 night too, mobs vandalized shops and roadside eateries, a hotel and a petrol pump.

title: Shiromani Akali to observe ‘Ardas Divas’ for eighty four riot victims
keywords: Chandigarh news, Chandigarh latest news, Chandigarh news live, Chandigarh news today, Today news Chandigarh, Sukhbir Singh Badal,Sikh,shiromani akali dal,ardas divas
content: CHANDIGARH:Shiromani Akali Dal(SAD) on Monday announced that it would observe ‘Ardas Divas’ at five Sikh Takhts to seek justice for the families of 1984 riot victims who were “brutally killed in mob violence perpetuated by the Congress party and its goons in Delhi as well as in other parts of the country.”The SAD leadership along with the party workers would participate in large numbers in the programme being observed on November 1 at all Sikh Takhts simultaneously.SAD vice-president and party spokesman Daljit Singh Cheema said this decision was taken by the core committee in its meeting held on Sunday under the chairmanship of the party patron Parkash Singh Badal and SAD presidentSukhbir Singh Badal.“A protest will also be held at Jantar Mantar in New Delhi on November 3 under the leadership of Parkash Singh Badal and Sukhbir Badal in which all party MPs, former MPs and MLAs, district presidents, SGPC members and others leaders will take part,” he added.

title: 12 arrested, over 350 booked in armed rioting in Pilibhit
keywords: Bareilly news, Bareilly latest news, Bareilly news live, Bareilly news today, Today news Bareilly, over 350 booked in armed rioting in Pilibhit,12 arrested
content: Pilibhit: A minor bicycle accident in Deshnagar Gaudi locality of Pilibhit city under Pilibhit Sadar Kotwali police triggered violent armed rioting on Vijya Dashmi night with over 150 locals from a specific community pelting stones and firing in air. On receiving the information, the senior police and administrative officials including the district magistrate, superintendent of police, ASP, CO of Pilibhit sadar circle and the city magistrate rushed to spot to review the situation. In order to control the situation, the SP called heavy police force from reserve police lines and the nearest police stations. The police nabbed as many as 12 anarchists from the spot while over 350 rioters have been booked under serious criminal sections. In view of upholding law and order, pickets of cops from both civil police and the provincial armed constabulary been deployed in the concerned area.According to the SP, Balendu Bhushan Singh, the police have lodged two separate FIRs in the matter of which one has been lodged by a local youth, Shivam Rajput, against 34 named and 100 to 150 unidentified rioters, while the other complaint has been lodged by the sub inspector of Theka police post of Kotwali police station, Siddharth Goswami, against 38 named and 100 to 150 anonymous trouble makers.The first FIR is lodged under IPC sections of 147 (rioting), 148 (rioting with deadly weapon), 149 (unlawful assembly guilty of offence committed in prosecution of common object), 307 (attempt to murder), 323 (Voluntarily causing hurt), 336 (an act done so rashly or negligently as to endanger human life or the personal safety of others) and 504 (Intentional insult with intent to provoke breach of peace) while the second FIR has been lodged under section 147, 148, 149, 307, 336 and 7 of criminal law (amendment) act.In his FIR, Shivam Rajput (19), a resident of Deshnagar Gaudi, stated that he was returning home at around 9 PM on Friday after working out in gymnasium when his bicycle unintentionally ran into 3-4 pedestrians who were moving on wrong side. Shivam alleges being abused and beaten after the incident.Reacting to the incident, his uncle Rajkumar, Joginder and Bunty approached the other side with their grievance. However, they were allegedly thrashed by a group of men belonging to the other community. Soon after this, a mob of over 150 persons started heavy stone pelting from the roofs of their houses with firing in air.The sub inspector, Goswami, also confirmed the incident stating that he witnessed the stone-pelting and fires being shot in the air when he was on night patrolling along with constable Sunu Kumar. He said that many commuters and cops sustained injuries as a result of stone pelting.Singh said that the injured were shifted to district government hospital for treatment and 12 rioters were arrested from the spot. “We have deployed heavy police force in the area and the situation is now under control”, he added.

title: Pennsylvania recognizes 1984 riots as 'Sikh genocide'
keywords: Amritsar news, Amritsar latest news, Amritsar news live, Amritsar news today, Today news Amritsar, Sikh,Pennsylvania,Genocide,amritsar
content: AMRITSAR: US state Pennsylvania's legislative assembly has passed a resolution terming anti-Sikh riots of November 1984 as 'Sikh genocide', American Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee (AGPC) coordinator Pritpal Singh told TOI on Thursday. The resolution was submitted by Alex Charlton and Jamie Santora as 'noncontroversial resolution' under Rule 35, he said.It said the Sikh community, which originated in Punjab (India), began immigrating into the United States over 100 years ago and had played an important role in developing the country and the Commonwealth. The resolution stated that the Sikh genocide began on November 1, 1984, after the assassination of Indian Prime Minister Indira Gandhi in Delhi and the states of Madhya Pradesh, Haryana, Uttarakhand, Bihar, Uttar Pradesh, West Bengal, Himachal Pradesh, Rajasthan, Orissa, Jammu and Kashmir, Chhattisgarh, Tripura, Tamil Nadu, Gujarat, Andhra Pradesh, Kerala and Maharashtra.On April 16, 2015, the California state assembly had unanimously passed 'assembly concurrent resolution' 34 which recognized the alleged 'systematic and organized' killings of Sikhs in Delhi and remembers those who lost their lives during the 1984 anti-Sikh riots.The resolution also talked about the mass grave discovered in 2011 at Hondh Chillar village in Haryana and 'widow colony' of Tilak Vihar in Delhi.It says that the Sikh genocide lasted three days and over 30,000 Sikhs were brutally murdered or died as they were hunted in their homes, where they were hacked and burned alive.Pritpal, who is also a member of American Sikh Caucus Committee, said that they (Sikh leaders) hailed Charlton and Santora for presenting and general assembly of Pennsylvania for passing the resolution.

title: ‘Jamai Badal’ first look poster promises a laugh riot
keywords: Soham Chakraborty,Rabi Kinagi,Paayel Sarkar,Koushani Mukherjee,jamai badal,Jamai 420,Hiran Chatterjee

The makers recently launched the first look poster from the film featuring all the protagonists and it promises to offer a laugh riot.Check out the poster here:Presenting the #FirstLook of #JamaiBadal, directed by @Ravikinagi and starring @myslf_soham, @Paayel_12353,… https://t.co/FE45Y7aecf— Surinder Films (@SurinderFilms)1540704600000While Paayel Sarkar was last seen in Joydip Mukherjee’s ‘Bhaijaan Elo Re’ earlier this year, Koushami Mukherjee is having an eventful year with her last ‘Hoichoi Unlimited’ opposite Dev did well at the Box Office. She has one more release this week, a romantic flick ‘Girlfriend’ opposite her boyfriend-actor Bonny Sengupta.Meanwhile, Soham is all geared up for his next ‘Bagh Bandi Khela’ releasing next month. Hiran was last seen in ‘Jio Pagla’ last year and the comedy flick was directed by the same Ravi Kinagi.

keywords: Sunny Deol,Preity zinta,Pankaj Tripathi,Mukul Dev,Metro International,Brijendra Kala,Arshad Warsi,Ameesha Patel
content: The makers of 'Bhaiaji Superhit' released a 2.43 mins trailer that featuresSunny DeolandPreity Zintaalong withArshad Warsi, Shreyas Talpade,Ameesha Patel, Sanjay Mishra,Brijendra Kala, Jaydeep Ahlawat,Mukul Dev,Pankaj Tripathiand Pankaj Jha.The trailer is nothing but hilarious. title: Peda riots: Victim’s family say receiving threats, demand police protection
keywords: Meerut news, Meerut latest news, Meerut news live, Meerut news today, Today news Meerut, Protection,PEDA,DM,clash,assembly polls
content: BIJNOR: The family members of 17-year-old Vishal Singh, who was killed during riots inPedavillage one-and-a-half years ago, protested before district magistrate’s (DM) office on Monday and demanded that the six of the eight accused booked be arrested immediately. They have alleged that they are getting threats from the accused and have demanded policeprotection.On February 10, 2017, just a day before the first phase of UPassembly polls, Vishal and his father Sanjay Kumar of Naya Ganv were shot at Bijnor’s Peda village. Vishal died of bullet injuries while Sanjay got injured. The two were sowing seeds in their field when the attack took place.Speaking to TOI, Sanjay Kumar said they have handed over a memorandum to DM Atal Rai, and addressed it to chief minister Yogi Aditynath over the matter.“My son֫—Vishal— was shot dead last year. Eighteen months have passed, but police have failed to arrest the accused. They are roaming freely and threatening us with dire consequence. I demand that all accused be arrested soon and my family be given police protection immediately.”Police had registered a case against eight persons of under IPC sections 147 (Punishment for rioting), 148 ((Rioting, armed with deadly weapon), 302 (punishment for murder), 307 (attempt to murder), 504 (Intentional insult with intent to provoke breach of the peace), based on the complaint filed by Sanjay Kumar.So far two persons were arrested, while six were declared fugitive by the police.

title: Three arrested for kidnapping vendor, rioting in Swati Market
keywords: City News,City Latest News, News, Times Of India, Latest news
content: Vadodara: The detection of crime branch (DCB) has arrested three persons who had kidnapped a vegetable vendor a fortnight ago.The accused - Anees Pathan, Shahrukh Pathan and Roshan Pathan - were had kidnapped Kanchan Harijan, who has a stall in Swati Market. The trio had kidnapped Harijan and threatened to kill him on October 3. The accused are also vegetable vendors.According to police, the accused and complainant had a dispute that led to the clashes on October 3. Mobs from both sides attacked each other and also damaged vehicles parked in the area. Harijan had alleged that the accused asked him to shut down his business and leave the area.They abducted him and took him to Shuklanagar market where they threatened him with life again and fled.

title: Riot of colours at this painting exhibition in Jaipur
keywords: Painting exhibition in Jaipur,Kumbh Mela,Jawahar Kala Kendra,Dr Sanjeeda Khanam,Dr Sanjay Kumar Sahani,Arjun Prajapati
content: An exhibition titled Pravah by artistsDr Sanjeeda KhanamandDr Sanjay Kumar Sahaniis being held atJawahar Kala Kendrain Jaipur. The three-day exhibition was inaugurated on Tuesday by Dr Ashwin M. Dalvi, chairman of Rajasthan Lalit Kala Akademi, Dr Surendra Kumari Soni, secretary, Rajasthan Lalit Kala Akademi andArjun Prajapati, Padma Shri awardee sculptor.Dr Sanjeeda KhanamTalking about her paintings, Sanjeeda said, “In this exhibition, I have displayed my paintings using acrylic media. Earlier, I used to make oil paintings. Nowadays, I use acrylic colours as I feel that acrylic colours enhances my creativity. I have derived inspiration from my travelling experience. Traveling to different places gives me fresh idea for my paintings.”Dr Sanjay Kumar SahaniSanjay, on the other hand, has put up paintings featuring sadhus at Kumbh Mela. “The MahaKumbh Melais considered the largest public gathering in the world. My paintings are an interpretation of Kumbh Mela in Varanasi. Every Sadhu, Sanyasi, leader, and follower gathers at Kumbh Mela and it is a sight to relish,” he said.

keywords: theatre,play,MLR Convention Centre,laughter therapy
content:
The plot of the play Laughter Therapy revolves around a Hindu, Muslim, Christian and Parsee, who walk into the therapy session of Dr Bombay’s clinic to help cope with various mental issues in their lives. The result is total chaos. We get a glimpse of the four religions in their domestic environment, as we get into the characters’ homes and witness their relationships with various people in their lives. Five actors play 35 characters in this play.
It is scheduled to take place atMLR Convention Centre, Whitefield, on October 20.

title: Ex-media advisor of AMU accuses former VC of ‘lying’ about 2002 Gujarat riots
keywords: Agra news, Agra latest news, Agra news live, Agra news today, Today news Agra, Vishisht Seva Medal,Mohammad Hamid Ansari,Laxminarayan Ramdas,India International Centre,Gujarat,AMU VC,agra
content: AGRA: Days after former Aligarh Muslim University (AMU) vice chancellor (VC) Lt General Zameer Uddin Shah’s comment on the 2002Gujaratriots, the varsity’s previous media advisor Jasim Mohammed has said that Shah had “twisted facts” to gain publicity for his upcoming memoir, ‘The Sarkari Mussalman’. The book, which will be formally launched by former Vice President Hamid Ansari at theIndia International Centrein New Delhi, is scheduled to hit the stands on Saturday.In an interview with a news agency recently, the former VC had said, “The crucial period was the intervening night of February 28 and March 1, 2002. I had met the then chief minister of Gujarat, Narendra Modi, at 2 am. My troop sat on the airfield an entire day on March 1. We got vehicles only on March 2. By then the damage had occurred. Some crucial hours were lost.”Hundreds had died in the riots that shook Gujarat that year.Mohammed claimed that Shah had met PM Modi on March 5, 2016 and complimented the latter for “controlling riots in a swift manner”. “I had accompanied Shah to Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s residence. During their interaction, Shah complimented Modi for controlling the riots in a swift manner. He had also thanked the PM for taking steps to quell the riots. He never mentioned about the delay in getting vehicles,” said Mohammed.When contacted, Shah, a recipient of the Param Vishish Seva Medal,Vishisht Seva Medaland Sena Medal for his services in the armed forces, said, “I never criticised the PM during my interviews. I have always stressed that the delay in providing logistics was an administrative failure. The riots were controlled within 48-hour by the Army. I have not twisted any facts. I stand by what I have stated.”Shah admitted that Mohammed had accompanied him to the PM’s house. TOI also has a copy of the letter that Admiral L Ramdas had sent Shah on October 10, 2018, which states: “At the time of the riots, Shah had informed me about how his troop had to wait one whole day before being provided with transport facilities by the authorities. Had the troop been allowed to restore law and order on the first day of the riots, many more lives would have been saved.”

title: In riot-hit UP village, man on a mission to bring Muslims back
keywords: Meerut news, Meerut latest news, Meerut news live, Meerut news today, Today news Meerut, Trust law,Sanjeev Kumar,Muzaffarnagar district,Jat people,Indian numbering system,hindu
content: Sanjeev Pradhan has a dream. He wants every Muslim family that was forced to leave his village Dulheda in UP’sMuzaffarnagar districtto now return home. Of the 65-odd Muslim families in Dulheda — situated in the Shahpur region of Muzaffarnagar — that fled after the deadly riots that shook the area in August and September 2013, Pradhan has persuaded around 30 to return.Pradhan’s efforts resonate more in the restive region because the 42-year-old had helped save several Muslim families during the riots by not only giving them shelter in his home but also ferociously guarding them at the places where they had taken refuge.Afsana Begum, who came back to the village after more than four years, recalls, “I remember how he and his men guarded our mosque. He wouldn’t let anyone touch it. He protected us with his life. If he says we should come back, I will trust him without thinking twice.” On his part, Pradhan says he judges people on the basis of their character, not religion.“Mussalman kharab hai? YaHindukharab hai? Insaan kharab hai (Is the Muslim bad, or is the Hindu bad? I will say it is the person who is bad). We need to fight and hope for change. I am only doing that,” he says.Sticking to his conviction has not been easy though. Pradhan, a former village head, had to incur criticism of the members of his Jat community (who make up most of the population of the village) for “being an obstacle when an opportunity had come for ridding the village of Muslim influence forever.”Nawab Singh, one of his supporters, says, “Sanjeev Pradhan lost the village head elections in 2015 and one of the primary reasons was his act of saving minority members’ lives in the riots. Some of the Hindus had even started greeting him with Salam-Alaikum in a sarcastic manner, claiming he was now almost a Muslim.”Looking back, Pradhan says he wouldn’t have done a thing differently. “I vividly remember the day — September 8, 2013. We could hear gunshots in the distance and, later, it became quite evident that the carnage had begun. Since most of the minority families and the lone mosque was near my house on the southern end of the village, we had started guarding their homes ever since the first murders were reported on August 27 in Kawal village, which triggered the riots.”Located just a kilometre away from Kutba, the village that witnessed the killing of eight Muslims, Dulheda, too, could not remain untouched by the violence that erupted, which eventually led to 62 deaths and the displacement of over 50,000 people from Muzaffarnagar district. However, Pradhan and his supporters unflinchingly resisted all attempts by people from neighbouring villages to stoke communal fires in their village.Bala Bano, a resident who returned to the village at Pradhan’s insistence, recalls those terrifying days. “We were full of fear and uncertainty. If Pradhan hadn’t been there, we would not have survived. When the situation started to deteriorate in the first week of September (2013), he called up our menfolk who were out of the village to immediately return and took us to the safety of his house, which was being guarded by his men. Even at night, he used to sit outside and keep vigil himself. We owe our lives to him.”Afsana remembers how Pradhan arranged for more than 300 Muslims to be escorted to the Palhera and Shahpur relief camps. “He wanted to come with us himself to the relief camps but we told him that could jeopardise his own safety. He, therefore, organised buggies to transport us to the camps. I remember we were extremely scared but his supporters, all Jats wielding arms, walked by our side throughout the way and ensured that nobody was harmed.”After the Muslim families had moved to the shelters, Pradhan made sure that their cattle were taken care of and their houses protected. Sajid Ahmad, one of those who returned after staying in a relief camp for some time, says, “Muslim families in the village do not have big landholdings and mostly depend on cattle rearing. So, it was a big relief when we came back to find that our cattle were safe.”Pradhan says that the village society works on mutual trust and can function optimally only when people co-operate with each other. “Muslims in the village are a big help to farmers like us. They help us during the cane harvest, build our houses and co-operate in so many other things. We are all dependent on each other and need to respect each other. I will keep trying to get them back home.”
