title: Gujarat: 17 held for rioting at Khodiyarnagar
keywords: Vadodara news, Vadodara latest news, Vadodara news live, Vadodara news today, Today news Vadodara, Sunil Gavaskar,Rabari,Madhya Pradesh,17 held for rioting at Khodiyarnagar
content: VADODARA: Seventeen persons were held on Wednesday in connection with rioting at Khodiyarnagar between locals and non-Gujaratis living in the area that took place late on Tuesday night.Several persons were injured in stone pelting which had snowballed out of a petty argument of not serving pani-puri for free. Later two groups registered separate cases of rioting against each other. Police have claimed that the ruckus did not take place because the pani-puri vendor was non-Gujarati as both the complainants are non-Gujaratis. However, of those who have been arrested, three persons are locals.The vendor Ravindra Singh Rathod, who hails fromMadhya Pradesh, told police that SunilRabaricame to his food cart for having the snack for free. When Rathod asked for money, Rabari got enraged and damaged Rathod’s bike and pick-up van with stones. Within few minutes, several others came out on streets and started pelting stones in which at least three persons were injured.A team of cops who were in the area rushed to the spot and dispersed the mob. Senior police officials denied that the incident had anything to do with attacks on non-Gujarati residents.

title: Improbable situations, deliberate absurdity make this play a laugh riot
keywords: UK,ROFL,Ray Cooney,Punjabi,Out of order,hindi,Cabinet Minister,Bengali,accident
content: 'Sweet Suite' is theHindiadaptation of 'Out Of Order' that had a long run in theUK, written by British playwrightRay Cooney. It is a farcical comedy that was written in 1990 and has been adapted in multiple languages across the world. Staged at LTG Auditorium, this adaptation by Nikunj Wadhawan is set in Suite 648 of a plush hotel in Delhi. A cabinet minister’s secretary Girija Shankar Das (Shom Gupta) books a suite to have an illicit affair with young and attractive Kamiya Chowdhary (Vijaya Rathore), the opposition’s secretary. However, not everything goes as planned and their romance soon turns into a misadventure with the discovery of a supposedly “dead body” stuck in the sash window of their suite.Fearing the headlines next day and the repercussions this awkward situation could have on his personal and professional life, Das does what any aspiring, philandering politician would do – not report anything to the hotel management or to the police. He instead calls up his junior assistant Purshottam Bagga (Nikunj Wadhawan) to help him dispose of the “corpse”.Cover-ups seldom go as planned, so hiding the “corpse” into a cupboard creates a lot of rib-tickling moments and a funny exchange of dialogues between Das and Bagga. As the plot progresses, the quick-witted Das churns out a pack of ingenious lies to save his devious skin. While the characters are truthful and believable, the situations they are caught up in are not-so-ordinary, exaggerated and implausible.COMIC TIMING: Nikunj WadhawanThe tangled web of lies that keeps building up between Das and Bagga and the rest of the cast leads to a lot ofROFLmoments. Both the actors have a good comic timing and effortlessly mouth several of their dialogues inBengaliandPunjabi, respectively. Ankur Saxena as an over-friendly and gossipy waiter and Dhruv Bhatia as the over-polite manager are quite relatable, too. Apart from the cast playing its roles quite convincing, there are moments when the unreliable window of the suite becomes the hero of the scene leading to a state of confusion and mayhem.With its door-slamming, trouser-dropping moments (of the jealous and obnoxious husband of the cheating secretary played by Sumit Bhott), the 85 minutes long play makes us laugh uncontrollably. Highly-exaggerated, improbable situations and a generous dose of elements like physical humour and deliberate absurdity make it an entertaining watch.Dhruv Bhatia and Sumit Bhott

title: For support in Patiala, Prakash Singh Badal revisits 1984 riots, Bluestar
keywords: Ludhiana news, Ludhiana latest news, Ludhiana news live, Ludhiana news today, Today news Ludhiana, Patiala district,Parkash Singh Badal,democracy,Bastion,amarinder singh,1984 anti-Sikh riots
content: PATIALA: Making an appeal to SAD workers to turn up in huge numbers for his rally in CMAmarinder Singh'sbastion, Patiala, on October 7, Shiromani Akali Dal patron Prakash Singh Badal said here on Tuesday that Punjabis should not forget the1984 anti-Sikh riotsand Operation Bluestar when it came to the Congress.Badal's statement came during his visit to assembly constituencies inPatiala districtas part of drumming up support for his rally, named 'Jabar Virodhi' (resisting repression). While Badal's rally will be held in Patiala, the CM will be holding a parallel rally in his predecessor's stronghold, Lambi.Badal said time had come for SAD to stand up against injustice meted out to SAD workers during recent block samiti and zila parishad elections. He said SAD workers should show no fear of false FIRs and instead be prepared to go to prison to protest against what he called "the murder of the democracy". "I have spent years in jails and become the chief minister," he said.He said he had never seen the misuse of government machinery to the extent to which the Congress had done in the recent block samiti and zila parishad polls. "People should hold chief minister Amarinder Singh accountable for the use of force and should not blame government officials, as they were simply following orders of the top boss," the former CM said.

title: In Captain’s citadel, Badals invoke Delhi riots, Operation Bluestar to take on Congress
keywords: Chandigarh news, Chandigarh latest news, Chandigarh news live, Chandigarh news today, Today news Chandigarh, Waddan, Libya,Sufism,Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee,Majha,Badals Bluestar,amarinder singh
content: PATIALA: SAD president Sukhbir Singh Badal and his father, former CM Parkash Singh Badal, invoked the 1984 anti-Sikh riots in Delhi, Operation Bluestar at Golden Temple, and the fight for Punjabi Suba, at their rally in CM Amarinder Singh’s stronghold, Patiala, on Sunday.Badal appealed to people at the rally to support the SAD’s Jabar Virodhi Rally to fight against “atrocities, injustices and cheating”, and to fight what he called as the Congress’s plan to take over the SGPC and its gurdwaras. Recalling the fight for ‘Punjabi Suba’, he said Congress had committed more than the Mughals and the British. “Youngsters do not even know or remember what Congress has done to them. Sikhs and their revered shrine, Darbar Sahib, were attacked in their own country by their own prime minister. I had visited the Golden Temple just two days after it was besieged in the Army’s attack and saw blood in its reservoir (sarowar). After this, Indira’s son Rajiv Gandhi took reigns as prime minister and innocent Sikhs were killed and burnt alive. But we are used to forgetting... We want peace and harmony, which have come back to Punjab after a long time and should not be disturbed,” he said.Badal recalled provocative statements that political leaders use to make during the days of militancy to disturb peace. “They would say ‘pehlan waddan ge monnay, pher waddan ge jhone (first, we will cut people with shorn hair and then paddy),” he said. “We don’t want this again.”He urged Sukhbir to hold the next rally in Doaba and then the third inMajha.Sukhbir called people behind desecration cases which took place during the SAD’s rule as ‘rakshas’ (demons). Speaking on the sacrilege case of Bargari, Faridkot, he said the crime was committed to disturb peace in Punjab. “If anyone was mortified at this development, it was SAD. The Congress used it as a defamation campaign against us and is still teaming up with elements who are using the name of the Panth to earn money,” he said.He said AAP leader Sukhpal Khaira did not have any respect for Guru Granth Sahib and had gone to Bargari only out of monetary interests.On Punjab CM Amarinder Singh’s visit to Lambi on Sunday, Sukhbir said, “Capt Amarinder found time to come to Lambi one and a half years after being rejected by people. He did not visit Darbar Sahib after winning the Lok Sabha election from there. He also does not care for many segments of Patiala, even though he was elected from the city in 2017. The Congress has closed down sewa kendras, stopped scholarships for SC students and even stopped CM Teerath Yatra Scheme,” he said.SAD leaders also took on the Congress government for refusing to reduce fuel prices. Meanwhile, BJP state president Shwait Malik asked the Congress to disclose what had happened to the 32 lakh jobs promised to the people.List of Taksali leadersAfter the rally, former CM Parkash Singh Badal asked SGPC former president Kirpal Singh Badungar to write down the names of Taksali Akalis or jathedars (political prisoners), including those who had faced imprisonment along with him. He said the names along with their sacrifices should be prepared so that they all could be honoured. The move comes at a time when there have been reports of party’s senior leaders not being happy with the leadership.The slogan ‘Sukhbir Badal zindabad’ was raised during most of the rally. Badal, in his speech, took only two names, of son Sukhbir and BJP state president Shwait Malik. He also thanked SGPC leaders, senior leaders of SAD, and party workers for attending the rally.Malik calls Badal a ‘sanyasi’In the beginning of his speech, BJP state president Shwait Malik called former CM Parkash Singh Badal a ‘darvesh’ (sufi saint) politician, but then took a break and said he was a ‘sanyasi’ (religious mendicant). Malik claimed that there were only two politicians in India who cared for farmers — PM Narendra Modi and Parkash Singh Badal.‘SAD not owned by Bada family’SAD president Sukhbir Singh Badal said the Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) was not a property of his family but it was the party of elders. He added that there was every chance that presidents of the party would change in the coming years.

title: Maharashtra: Rioting cases against Bhima Koregaon accused Sambhaji Bhide dropped
keywords: Mumbai news, Mumbai latest news, Mumbai news live, Mumbai news today, Today news Mumbai, Shivpratishthan Hindustan,Sambhaji Bhide,old rioting cases sambhaji bhide,Mumbai based activist Shakeel Ahmed,BJP-led Maharashtra government,Bhima Koregaon violence case
content: MUMBAI: TheBJP-led Maharashtra governmenthas taken back decade old rioting cases that were registered againstSambhaji Bhide, leader of right-wing groupShivpratishthan Hindustan, who has been booked in theBhima Koregaon violence case.The information accessed byMumbai based activist Shakeel AhmedSheikh after he filed an RTI application in March 2018 seeking details of the number of common people and politicians against whom criminal cases have been taken back between 2008 till December 2017.Bhide along with Milind Ekbote was booked earlier this year after violent clashes broke out on January 1 between Dalit and Maratha groups at Bhima Koregaon village near Pune.As per the information, there were three cases of rioting that were registered in Sangli in 2008 for allegedly vandalising cinema halls screening the movie, Jodhaa Akbar. These cases were withdrawn by a cabinet sub-committee under Finance minister Sudhir Mungantiwar in June 2017, just six months before Bhima Koregaon clashes. The committee was constituted to review cases that were filed against political activists.In one of the case, besides charges against Bhide, charges against 41 members of the Shivpratishthan Hindustan."What is the interest of the Maharashtra government in dropping charges against them. The government must explain why these people were treated specially," said Sheikh.Officials of the state Home Department said there are several old cases that are likely to be withdrawn following a Cabinet decision on August 30, 2016. The cases were termed 'ineffective' and it was decided to withdraw them under Sections 288 and 321 of CrPC.Meanwhile, many cases against political leaders too have been dropped in the last few years. "A total of 41 cases have been withdrawn by the government in the last one year, of which 14 cases were dropped against MLA's, mostly from BJP and Sena," said Sheikh.“The cases that have been revoked involved cases related to participation in political or social agitations. We have taken back cases against many people, Bhide being one of them. The Congress-NCP government had taken the decision to withdraw cases that were registered for protesting for public welfare. These cases have been dropped after taking appropriate permission from the courts," said Mungatiwar.Meanwhile, the government has clarified that these cases do not include that of the Koregaon-Bhima case.Minister for Home (State) Deepak Kesarkar clarified the cases that have have been dropped against Bhide are related to the agitation following the release of theHindi filmJodhaa Akbar and Koregaon-Bhima violence of 2018. “We have not withdrawn a single case in connection with the Koregaon Bhima violence."Also See:Best Bollywood Movies of 2018

title: Maharashtra police drop rioting cases against Sambhaji Bhide
keywords: Pune news, Pune latest news, Pune news live, Pune news today, Today news Pune, western Maharashtra,Sambhaji Bhide,right-wing leader Sambhaji Bhide,Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh,Maharashtra police,koregaon-bhima
content: PUNE: TheMaharashtra Policewithdrew old rioting cases against right-wing leaderSambhaji Bhide, six months before the violence inKoregaon-Bhimanear Pune, response to an RTI query has revealed.The cases were filed against Bhide in 2008 and 2009 in Sangli inwestern Maharashtra, it said.According to the RTI response, six cases against Bhide and his organisation were filed following two protests---one against Bollywood movie 'Jodha Akbar' in 2008 and another against an artist's depiction of the assassination of Shivaji in 2009. The protesters indulged in rioting, stone-pelting and burning of several tyres, it said.A senior police official, however, said Monday the charges against the 85-year-old in the Koregaon-Bhima violence case have not been dropped.Bhide, a formerRashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh(RSS) activist who heads Shiv Pratishthan Hindustan, is an accused in the January 1 Bhima-Koregaon caste violence case."The cases against Bhide that were withdrawn were old cases in Sangli and have nothing to do with the Koregaon-Bhima violence," Superintendent of Pune (rural) police Sandip Patil said."The investigation in the Koregaon-Bhima violence case, in which Bhide and (Hindu Ekta Aghadi leader) Milind Ekbote are accused, is in progress," the IPS officer said.Patil said Pune police had in August arrested five activists while probing an alleged Maoist link to a meeting of the Elgaar Parishad in Pune on the eve of the January 1 violence in Koregaon-Bhima."We are waiting for the development in that case, that is why (filing of) charge sheet in our (Koregaon-Bhima) case is pending," he added.

title: Three injured, 5 shops set ablaze in Halvad rioting
keywords: Rajkot news, Rajkot latest news, Rajkot news live, Rajkot news today, Today news Rajkot, shops blaze,rioting,Injured person,fire
content: RAJKOT: Three persons were injured and five shops set on fire by mobs after a communal riot broke out in Jangari locality of Halvad in Morbi district on Wednesday night.At least 17 people were rounded up by police on Thursday for their involvement in the communal riot that started at Jangari and spread to Main Bazaar, Kharawad, Tikkar Road, Azad Chowk and Ghanshyamgadh Road.There was an altercation between two youths belonging to majority and minority communities when a tazia procession was being taken out to observe Muharram last week. Both the youths were dissuaded from stretching the issue further by their community members. On Wednesday night, members of both the communities met at Jangari to reach a compromise. Approximately 12 people from Hindu group and 30 from Muslim group arrived to discuss the issue.“An abuse allegedly hurled by a member of Muslim group triggered off the clash. Muslims attacked Bajrang Dal Halwad president Bhavesh Thakkar (40) and Bajrang Dal worker Alpesh Parejia (24) with bats and iron pipes. Hindus started to pelt the rival group with stones causing injury to a Muslim,” Morbi superintendent of police Karanraj Vaghela said.Dhawal Shukla of Bajrang Dal and Imtiyaz Rathod of Muslim group lodged counter complaints against each other at the local police station.Two companies of State Reserve Police, three deputy superintendents of police, five inspectors, 10 police sub-inspectors and personnel belonging to Morbi local crime branch and Morbi special operation group are assisting the local police in the maintenance of law and order in the town.Meanwhile, Vishwa Hindu Parishad (VHP) called a bandh in Halvad on Thursday and its activists forced shops to down shutters and schools and colleges to remain closed. The VHP took out a rally to demand arrest of the accused. Around 1,000 VHP members also blocked traffic at Azad Chowk of Halwad and announced that they would continue to enforce bandh on the town until the arrest of the accused.

title: 'Maaza Agadbam' trailer: The Trupti Bhoir and Subodh Bhave starrer is a complete laugh riot
keywords: Usha Nadkarni,Trupti Bhoir,Subodh Bhave,Maaza,Agadbam
content: After the initial success of the movie, ‘Agadbam’, actress and producerTrupti Bhoirare returning with its sequel 'MaazaAgadbam'. Recently the makers of the film shared the trailer of the film on the social media.The trailer opens with actress Trupti who is twice as ‘Agadbam’ andSubodh Bhave, playing the role of her husband in an altogether different manner.The trailer definitely looks fun and tells us that it’s going to be twice as funny as the first film. Trupti Bhoir looks even more convincing in her character now and the theme of wrestling makes the film unique in every way. It would be fun to see how the chemistry between Subodh and Trupti’s characters work out in for film.Trupti Bhoir's directorial ' MaazaAgadbam' produced under the banner of Trupti Bhoir Filmss & Pen Studios also features Tanaji Galgunde,Usha Nadkarni, Jaywant Wadkar, and Mike Wietecha. The film is set to release on 26 October.

title: Azam, supporters booked for rioting at neighbour’s house
keywords: Bareilly news, Bareilly latest news, Bareilly news live, Bareilly news today, Today news Bareilly, samajwadi party,Faisal Raza Khan,Deadly weapons,Azam khan booked for rioting,Azam
content: RAMPUR: Police on Wednesday registered an FIR againstSamajwadi PartyleaderAzamKhan and his three supporters for rioting and other offences based on the complaint of the former UP minister’s neighbour.In his police complaint, Arif Raza Khan, a resident of Ghair Meer Baaz Khan, Jail Road, alleged that Azam wants to occupy his house and has been threatening him and his family to leave the locality.“An FIR has been filed against Azam Khan, Farhan Khan, Salman Shamsi, Uzair Khan and six unidentified persons under IPC sections 147 (rioting), 148 (rioting armed withdeadly weapons), 149 (every member of unlawful guilty of offence committed in prosecution of common object), 323 (voluntary causing hurt), 452 (house trespass after preparation for hurt), 427 (mischief), 504 (intentional assault with intent to provoke breach of the peace) and 506 (criminal intimidation), apart from section 67-A of the IT Act,” said Vidyut Goyal, SHO, Ganj Kotwali police station.The complainant’s son,Faisal Raza Khan, said, “On three separate occasions, September 1,5 and 6, the former minister and his men created ruckus outside our house. On one occasion they threatened to kill us and also broke the CCTV camera installed at the entry gate.”Earlier, after finding the complainant’s charges true, the SP had asked the local police to deploy four constables at Arif Raza Khan’s residence for security.“We have filed an FIR and are investigating the matter. Appropriate action will be taken against the accused,” said the SHO.When TOI tried to contact Azam Khan for his comment, his media in-charge, Fashat Ali Khan, said, “He (Azam) doe s not want to comment on this issue.”

title: When cycling bards sparked a laugh riot in Bengaluru
keywords: William Shakespeare,The HandleBards,Romeo and Juliet,Ranga Shankara
content: The air is infectious as the audience and the cast members play catch and catch with a beach ball. What’s the occasion? The super quirky theatre troupe from the UK,The HandleBards, are performing their uniquely hilarious adaptation of Shakespeare’s timeless theatrical masterpiece,Romeo and Juliet. After a performance where actors Lucy Green, Charlotte Driessler, Eleanor Chaganis and Sian Eleanor Green, along with director Nel Crouch, put on funny attires, over-the-top props and draw huge bouts of laughter from the audience, members from the team spoke toBTabout the experience of expecting the unexpected, throwing a comical spin on a classic and more.Dealing with chaosTalking about the dynamic nature of the play, Nel says, “I don’t travel with the girls every time they perform. But each time I do manage to catch the show on stage, I realise something new has been added.” In an unexpected turn of events, ahead of one of their shows in Bengaluru, Eleanor lost her voice and Nel stepped up to share the role. Yet, there was no cutting back on quality. If anything, the play got more funny. “Well, the show must go on,” laughs Nel.Choosing to perform ShakespeareShakespeare’s mastery over the English language is a big draw for the team to take up the plays. “Our founders are passionate about his works. And there are no rights to be bought for the plays,” says Lucy. The troupe believes that people often get intimidated with the bard’s linguistic prowess. Nel explains, “This is one of the reasons we perform outdoors. We want to make it casual and make Shakespeare accessible.”Making theatre accessibleFor their European performances, the team travels on their bicycles, carrying all the set, props and costumes needed to perform. “We want to take art and culture beyond performances in major cities to the inner locales,” says Lucy. When on tour, away from Europe, the team perform in schools, so that the bard’s works pass on to the next generation. Have they travelled in India by bicycle? “We are kind of overwhelmed by the traffic,” they laugh nervously.Roles not bound by gender“The company started as an all-boys gang. However, we felt the need for a female group, and it is interesting to experiment with this, because when it comes to the bard, the male roles are often meatier,” says Nel. This kind of a comedic spin on a classic, the girls believe, is super-fun to play around with, as it completely changes the gender game. “When gender is not a priority, whoever is right for the role, gets the part. On one occasion, we even had one of the men go up and perform the role of Juliet,” says Lucy. Such a practice results in creating an environment enabling empowerment. “When the boys used to perform, people would tell them that women cannot be as funny as men. Well, here we are!” the girls sign off.The team are all set to perform Romeo and Juliet on October 4 and October 5 atRanga Shankara, 7.30 pm.

title: Charges of rioting framed against Somnath Bharti
keywords: Delhi news, Delhi latest news, Delhi news live, Delhi news today, Today news Delhi, Somnath Bharti,rioting,Indian Penal Code,Democratic Republic of the Congo,AAP
content: NEW DELHI: A Delhi court on Wednesday framed charges ofrioting, unlawful assembly and voluntarily causing hurt to an African student in 2014 againstAAPleaderSomnath Bharti.The court ordered putting Bharti on trial after finding enough prima facie material against him for allegedly assaulting Mukoko Misa Tresar, a citizen of Democratic Republic of Congo, who was then studying at Amity University, Noida.According to the police, on September 26, 2014, Tresar was assaulted by a mob led by the accused.“Let a notice under Section 323/147 read with Section 149 and under Section 109 of theIndian Penal Codebe framed against the accused Somnath Bharti,” the court held.The charges under sections 323 (punishment for voluntarily causing hurt), 147 (punishment for rioting), read with Section 149 (every member of unlawful assembly guilty of offence committed in prosecution of common object) and under Section 109 (punishment of abetment if the act abetted is committed in consequence and where no express provision is made for its punishment) of the IPC were framed.Advocate Vijay Agarwal, appearing for Bharti, denied all the allegations made against his client. The counsel argued that the complainant did not categorically say that the accused was leading the mob or involved in beating the complainant.The court, meanwhile, said that since there was lack of requisite sanction from the concerned authorities, the cognisance of offence under Section 153 (A) (promoting enmity between different groups on ground of religion, race, place of birth, residence, language, etc.) of IPC was not taken.

title: Offences against some for trying to cause riot
keywords: Surat news, Surat latest news, Surat news live, Surat news today, Today news Surat, social media,police are yet to arrest the accused.,Indian Penal Code,facebook,cause riot
content: SURAT: Two offences were registered at the crime branch for trying to create riot throughsocial mediaon Saturday. However,police are yet to arrest the accused.Police booked Vikas Aahir and some unidentified persons for allegedly sharing message on theirFacebookwall. The accused shared details about the fracas at Mumbai Vad area and asked the police to take strict action against accused and also used abusive language. The message, which was shared under the name of a group belonging to majority community, proclaimed that their protest would continue until those involved in Mumbai Vad incident were punished.“We are yet to make any arrest in the case. Our investigation is on to identify the person who had written this message. Police are keeping an eye on messages being shared on social media,” said a police officer at the crime branch.Some men belonging to minority community had allegedly entered the pandal of Lord Ganesha at Mumbai Vad locality falling under the limits of Salabatpura police station and clashed with the organizers on Friday last. A small idol of Lord Ganesha in the pandal was damaged in the scuffle between the two groups. Police had booked 15 people who were involved in this incident.The other offence relates to two men in a hate video that has gone viral on social media. “The two men had intentionally shot the video so as tocause riotin the city. They have been booked and we are working to identify them. They will be arrested definitely,” a police officer said.The accused in both the cases have been booked underIndian Penal CodeSection 153 (Wantonly giving provocation with intent to cause riot).

title: Police involved in 1997 Coimbatore riots, says BJP ex-MP
keywords: Coimbatore news, Coimbatore latest news, Coimbatore news live, Coimbatore news today, Today news Coimbatore, says BJP ex-MP,Police involved in 1997 Coimbatore riots
content: Coimbatore: Senior BJP leader and chairman of the Coir Board C P Radhakrishnan stoked a fresh controversy by alleging that police were involved in the Coimbatore riots of 1997 that followed the murder of traffic police constable R Selvaraj.Radhakrishnan represented the Coimbatore Lok Sabha constituency for two terms between 1998 and 2004. He said the BJP and Hindu outfits did not expose the police role in the riots all along.Addressing among the Hindu Munnani workers at Theppakulam ground here on Monday, Radhakrishnan said traffic police constable Selvaraj had stopped three people who were travelling in a two -wheeler and did not allow the triple ride. So, he was brutally murdered in the day light in November 1997. “All that followed were not done by BJP or Hindu Munnani. It was all done by police personnel who could not bear the murder of Selvaraj. But we did not expose the involvement of the police at any situation. But Hindutva people who were not involving in any riots, were spending their days behind the bars. Exposing the police is equal to betraying the nation,” said Radhakrishnan.Later, he met reporters and said that Ganesha Chathurthi festival has been indicating that Tamil Nadu state returning to its spiritual feelings. Some people were telling that Tamil Nadu is the land of Periyar and atheists. But this is a spiritual land. “Unidentified people desecrated the statue of Periyar at Dharapuram in Tirupur district. BJP is not having any faith on such dishonorable activities. The greatness of the saffron is that it opposes ideas with ideas. We won’t take the violence in our hands. At the same time, we won’t bend to violence,” said Radhakrishnan.

title: Fight over DJ music snowballs into communal riots near Borsad
keywords: Vadodara news, Vadodara latest news, Vadodara news live, Vadodara news today, Today news Vadodara, Special Operations Groups (Spain),mosque,ganesha,Anand district
content: VADODARA/ ANAND: A verbal spat over loud DJ music between two groups snowballed into clashes between mobs of two communities in Pipli village of Anand’s Borsad taluka during Ganesha immersion procession on Sunday.Sources said that the groups resorted to stone pelting clashed after dispute over playing music and bursting fire crackers near amosquelocated in the village. The processions were going on peacefully in the morning. Earlier, in the day, two mandals had already taken out immersion processions from the same route that passes from the heart of the village. But fight erupted when a Ganesha mandal, with youth from the Darbar community, took out a procession from near the masjid.There was a heated altercation the mandal members and a group from the minority community standing outside the mosque. Soon, a group allegedly started abusing members from the minority community. Situation turned ugly when some members of the procession threw stones on the mosque, police said, adding this led to heavy stone pelting.Police, which was accompanying the procession, tried to control crowd from both the sides, but after their attempts turned futile, they alerted bothAnand districtcontrol room and Bhadran police.The stone pelting which had started at around 12 noon continued for nearly 30 minutes. It was only after teams from local crime branch, special operations groups and additional force rushed to the spot that the situation was brought under control. The teams also started foot patrolling in the village and some miscreants were detained by Bhadran police.Till late night, the police was in the process of registering a formal complaint regarding the riots. Some glass windows of the mosque also got damaged in the stone pelting.Earlier too, members from both the Darbar and minority community have clashed at the village.At Vadeli village of Borsad taluka, there was a skirmish between groups belonging to Patel and Darbar communities. In Borsad town, two groups also entered into heated arguments over a road which was blocked for taking out the immersion procession. However, a compromise was struck later.

title: NLIU memes a laugh riot on campus
keywords: Bhopal news, Bhopal latest news, Bhopal news live, Bhopal news today, Today news Bhopal, Schutzstaffel,internet meme,facebook,campus,Autonomous law schools in India
content: BHOPAL: Memes posted by NLUI students on social media to express their views over the state of affairs on the law universitycampushave become a hit. A group called NLIU Memes is active onFacebookwhere students posts satirical memes to raise issues that are plaguing the law university. Taking a cue, other law students have also started posting memes in the group, making it a huge hit.Students said the group was started last year after all their efforts to raise their voice on the campus failed.“There was so much resentment among students against former director SS Singh that a few of them got off to launch a memes group on social media,” said a student without quoting his name.After the group’s success, students started using it as a medium to express their views on various issues on the campus. “Students regularly post on it about routine issues. Whether it is about teaching faculty, ragging, routine issues or others, students post memes without any hesitation. Since all group members are law students, it is easy for them to understand the post’s meaning,” said another student without quoting her name.A meme with a picture of former director SS Singh, reads, “Yeh marks badhane ke liye protest karna zarooree hai kya (Is it necessary to organise protests for increasing marks).” This meme was posted when students were holding protests against Singh. The agitation led to removal of Singh from the post of director. However, even after the protest ended, students continued to post memes in the group due to the overwhelming response. “Latest posts are all about ongoing issues on the campus,” said another student.Raising the issue of ragging on the campus, students posted a meme showing a picture of students with captions “Batch of 2022” and “the floor is UGC complaints”. Students said the meme was about the trend of ragging complaints.Taking pot shots at the university’s name, a meme showing a student scratching his head, reads, “My College is called National Law University, but it is established by a state legislation.”

title: SC sends 2007 rioting case against Adityanath back to magistrate for reasoned order
keywords: India, India news, India news today, Today news, Google news, Breaking news, Yogi Adityanath,Uttar Pradesh,hindu,hate speech,Gorakhpur,dipak misra,Allahabad High Court
content: NEW DELHI: The Supreme Court on Tuesday asked the chief judicial magistrate ofGorakhpurto pass a reasoned order on a case filed againstUttar Pradeshchief ministerYogi Adityanathfor allegedly delivering ahate speechin 2007 which led to disturbances in the city.A bench of Chief JusticeDipak Misraand justices A M Khanwilkar and D Y Chandrachud remitted the case back to the magistrate and upheld the order of theAllahabad High Courtwhich had in February 2018 asked the lower court to re-examine the issue and pass a fresh order.The petitioner, Rasheed Khan, had challenged the HC order. Khan had filed an FIR in January 2007 about the incident and the chief judicial magistrate had taken cognisance of the chargesheet in June. Seven years after the incident, one of the accused approached the sessions judge on the ground that sanction granted by the state government to prosecute Adityanath, who was then a Member of Parliament, was not signed by the authority concerned and that decision of the magistrate to take cognisance was bad in law.The sessions judge allowed the plea setting aside the cognisance order of the magistrate in 2017 and remitted the case back to the magistrate to pass fresh order in accordance with the law. The complainant had then challenged the order in HC which also dismissed his plea.The FIR said that on January 27, 2007, on the occassion of Satvi Moharram, Adityanath had given a call, following which members of right-wing outfitHinduVahini and others raised slogans. The agitators allegedly indulged in destructive activities after which police fired several rounds in the air.The FIR was lodged on charges of rioting, outraging religious feelings, trespassing on burial places and promoting enmity between groups.

title: Memories of 2013 are too scary: Muzaffarnagar riots victims
keywords: Bareilly news, Bareilly latest news, Bareilly news live, Bareilly news today, Today news Bareilly, Shamli district,shamli,muzaffarnagar,Jola people,Indian Army,Colony,Adeeb
content: MUZAFFARNAGAR: Five years after communal riots displaced over 50,000 people inMuzaffarnagarandShamlidistricts of western UP, the victims still remember their homes, but are in no mood to return. “Our ancestors are buried in those villages, but the memories of 2013 are too scary for us to even think about going back,” said Gafur Ahmed, 45, who fled from his house in Bahawadi village ofShamli districtduring the riots.Gafur and six other members of his family are currently staying in a resettlementcolonyin Muzaffarnagar’s Jola village. “As many as 25 families from Bahawadi are currently living here in Ekta colony, which was set up after the riots for displaced families like ours. No one from here has ever gone back,” he said.RehanaAdeebfrom Astitva, an NGO working for riots victims, said, “Not a single person has returned to villages like Lank and Bahawadi in Shamli and Phugana, Kakra and Kutba in Muzaffarnagar. People are just too scared to return and the administration has not been able to win their confidence.”Taju Ahmad, 65, who retired from theIndian Army, is currently living with his family in a resettlement colony in Shahpur area in Muzaffarnagar. “We used to happily live in our own house in Kakra village. But everything changed after 2013. Today, we are living in poor conditions and have to face taunts for members of other communities who call us refugees. However, we will never go back as we cannot risk the life of our children,” he said.“No politician has bothered to see us in the last two years.,” said Rashid Ahmed from Ekta colony.Muzaffarnagar DM Rajeev Sharma said, “We cannot force people to return to their villages but can ensure their safety and security. Anyone who wants to go back will get the administration complete help and support. There is nothing to fear.”

title: Hindu takes care of mosque he saved during 2013 riots
keywords: Meerut news, Meerut latest news, Meerut news live, Meerut news today, Today news Meerut, muzaffarnagar,mosque,hindu,Firozabad,Darul Uloom,Dara Singh
content: MUZAFFARNAGAR: At the height of communal tension during the 2013 riots inMuzaffarnagarwhen a group of rioters decided to demolish a 120-year-old mosque, Ramveer Kashyap put up a staunch defence, even gathering other villagers in his support. Five years later, the 59-year-old mason is still taking care of the onlymosquein Muzaffarnagar’s Nanheda village. At daybreak, he cleans up the mosque, lights a candle in the evening, and even gets the structure whitewashed before every Ramzan. “It’s my religious duty. My faith teaches me to respect all places of worship,” he told TOI.Incidentally, the village doesn’t have a single Muslim inhabitant. Located 40 km from the district headquarters, Nanheda is a Jat-dominated village with a few Dalits and OBCs residing here.According to Ramveer, the village had a large number of Muslims before Independence. “However, they moved out. Now, an occasional visitor offers namaz here once in a while,” he said.Khusnaseeb Ahmad, a healthcare professional in the neighbouring KhediFirozabadvillage, is one of those visitors. “I visited the village few years ago and was surprised to see aHinduman looking after the mosque. I offered namaz there. There are many examples of love to counter hate,” he said.Ramveer stays barely 100 metres away from the mosque. “I played around it as a child. For me, it is a place of worship, which deserves respect. As there was no one to take care of it, I took on the responsibility. For the past 25 years, I sweep the premises daily and ensure basic maintenance,” Ramveer said.Nanheda village pradhanDara Singhis all praise for Ramveer. “He even spends his own money to get it whitewashed once before every Ramzan. At times, his family members also assist him in cleaning up the place.”Ashraf Usmani, in-charge, organisation and development department ofDarul Uloom, said, “It is this aspect of India that makes it great. Examples likes Nanheda are spread all across India. Soon after partition when all Muslims moved to Pakistan especially from Punjab, there were Sikhs and Hindus who protected and preserved mosques which are still there. Similarly, there are instances of Muslims protecting temples in many places.”

title: Five years after Muzaffarnagar riots, free education for victims’ children continues to be an unfulfilled dream
keywords: Meerut news, Meerut latest news, Meerut news live, Meerut news today, Today news Meerut, muzaffarnagar,Jola people,Jamshed Ahmed,Free Education,Colony,2013 Muzaffarnagar riots
content: MUZAFFARNAGAR: It was a school conceived with the noble idea of providingfree educationto hundreds of children ofMuzaffarnagarriots victims. Local residents had donated land for the institute and AMU had provided a grant of Rs 50 lakh. However, five years down the line, out of 325 students in Sir Syed National School in Muzaffarnagar’s Jola village, only 20 children of riots-hit people study here. According to some riots victims, the promise of free education was a farce as it costs nearly Rs 15,000 annually to send a child to the school.“We were promised that our children will be given free education. Later, however, we were told that we need to pay tuition fees, buy books and uniform and pay for other expenses. It felt like a rude joke. We are living in a resettlementcolonyand cannot afford to spend that much on our children’s education,” said Rashid Ahmed, who lives in Ekta colony, which is barely 300metres from the school. Rashid has four children and all of them are enrolled in a nearby government school.Rashid’s neighbour Abid Ahmad said, “I have four children. I want to give them quality education but cannot afford to send them to private schools. We had high hopes from this institute. We were promised free education, but were later made to realize that nothing is for free.”The school management, however, had a different story to tell. Mohd Anas, a member of the management committee, said, “We just charge a monthly tuition fess of Rs 550. We also provide free evening tuitions to children of riots victims for three to four hours daily. Students from all backgrounds are enrolled here. Our school is affiliated to CBSE and we provide quality education to all.”Meanwhile, Jola village pradhanJamshed Ahmedsaid, “Frankly, majority of people who were displaced in 2013 cannot afford to send their children to Sir Syed National School. While the institute’s tuition fee is not too high, there are other expenses involved. My children go to Sir Syed National School and I know that it costs nearly Rs 15,000 annually to send one child to the school.”

title: Police scolded us instead of saving us: Bhima riots witness
keywords: Mumbai news, Mumbai latest news, Mumbai news live, Mumbai news today, Today news Mumbai, Shivaji,Koregaon Bhima,Hindutva,ghatkopar,Devendra Fadnavis,Bhima riots witness,Ambedkar Nagar district
content: MUMBAI: The police were scolding us, instead of protecting us, said Tanaji Sable, one of the witnesses in theKoregaon Bhimaviolence case, during his cross-examination before a two-member judicial commission on Friday.In the wake of large-scale violence across the state following clashes between two groups after the death of a youth on January 1 in Koregaon Bhima, chief ministerDevendra Fadnavishad set up a two-member judicial commission, comprising former Chief Justice J N Patel and chief information commissioner Sumit Mullick, to conduct a probe."On January 1, the situation at Koregaon Bhima was scary. Mobile network was not available. Stones were being pelted. The road leading to Vijay Stambh was also closed. While all these incidents were happening, the police, instead of providing help, kept shouting and scolding us, and shoving us to move out of the area," said Sable (49), a BEST conductor who lives inGhatkopar's Ramabai Ambedkar Nagar. He had filed an affidavit before the commission on July 18.He told the commission: "I did not say that I saw people holding flags burning tyres. But they were shouting slogans like 'Jai Bhavani, JaiShivaji'."Rajendra Shankar Gaikwad, the 10th generation descendant of Govind Gopal Gaikwad-a Mahar community hero who performed the last rites of Chhatrapati Shivaji's son Sambhaji Maharaj-was present before the commission. The cross-examination of Gaikwad, who turned 57 on Friday, could not be held as he was not carrying the original documents submitted to the judicial commission.Hindutvaleader Milind Ekbote, prime accused in the riots case, was also present for the hearing on Friday.

title: Five years after Muzaffarnagar riots, victims too scared to return to native villages
keywords: Meerut news, Meerut latest news, Meerut news live, Meerut news today, Today news Meerut, Muzaffarnagar riots
content: Muzaffarnagar: Five years after communal riots displaced over 50,000 people in Muzaffarnagar and Shamli districts of western UP, the victims still remember their homes, but are in no mood to return. “Our ancestors are buried in those villages, but the memories of 2013 are too scary for us to even think about going back,” said Gafur Ahmed, 45, who fled from his house in Bahawadi village of Shamli district during the riots.Gafur and six other members of his family are currently staying in a resettlement colony in Muzaffarnagar’s Jola village. “As many as 25 families from Bahawadi are currently living here in Ekta colony, which was set up after the riots for displaced families like ours. No one from here has ever gone back,” he said.Rehana Adeeb from Astitva, an NGO working for riots victims, said, “Not a single person has returned to villages like Lank and Bahawadi in Shamli and Phugana, Kakra and Kutba in Muzaffarnagar. People are just too scared to return and the administration has not been able to win their confidence.”Taju Ahmad, 65, who retired from the Indian Army, is currently living with his family in a resettlement colony in Shahpur area in Muzaffarnagar. “We used to happily live in our own house in Kakra village. But everything changed after 2013. Today, we are living in poor conditions and have to face taunts for members of other communities who call us refugees. However, we will never go back as we cannot risk the life of our children,” he said.“No politician has bothered to see us in the last two years. Look at the roads here. Power supply is intermittent and on some days we just don’t get water. Come 2019 and leaders from all political parties will line up here for our votes,” said Rashid Ahmed from Ekta colony.Talking to TOI, Muzaffarnagar district magistrate Rajeev Sharma said, “We cannot force people to return to their villages but can ensure their safety and security. Anyone who wants to go back will get the administration complete help and support. There is nothing to fear.”

title: Peda riots: Court rejects plea seeking withdrawal of case against BJP leader
keywords: Meerut news, Meerut latest news, Meerut news live, Meerut news today, Today news Meerut, Roits,Rajendra Singh,PEDA,fir,BJP
content: BIJNOR: In a jolt toBJPleader Aishwarya Chaudhary, husband of Bijnor MLA Suchi Chaudhary and an accused in 2016Pedariots, a local court has rejected an application filed by the prosecution seeking withdrawal of case against him.Four people were killed and over a dozen others were injured in communal clashes in Bijnor’s Peda village in September 2016.On the orders of the state government, district government counsel Ajay Agarwal filed an application in the court of the additional district judge claiming that the BJP leader’s name was not mentioned in theFIRinitially. However, the court on Wednesday rejected the application.Talking to TOI, Aishwarya Chaudhary’s fatherRajendra Singh, who is a practicing lawyer, said, “Aishwarya was charged with inciting mob. However, he wasn’t even present at the spot at the time of the incident. The families of the victims did not mention his name in their police complaint. As part of a political conspiracy, his name was later added to the FIR. My son is innocent and we will continue our fight for justice.”Soon after communal clashes in Peda village, which is barely 4km from the district headquarters, top officials from administration and police had camped in the district and heavy force was deployed in the entire region.According to sources, as many as 29 people were initially named in the FIR, which did not include Aishwarya Chaudhary. However, the BJP leader’s name was added four days later.Peda was again in news in 2017 when just a day before the first phase of UP assembly elections, a father-son duo was shot in the adjacent Naya Gaon village. The incident had triggered communal tension in the area.

title: Kasganj riots: Independent probe report alleges lapses in police investigation, seeks HC-monitored probe
keywords: Lucknow news, Lucknow latest news, Lucknow news live, Lucknow news today, Today news Lucknow, Sajid Hameed,Republic day,Kasganj Riots,Kasganj district,Allahabad High Court
content: NEW DELHI: An independent group of social activists and citizens on Wednesday alleged serious lapses in the police investigation into riots that occurred inKasganj districtin January this year, and sought a fresh investigation monitored by theAllahabad high court.The group, People’s Collective, released a report here detailing the conclusions made by a fact-finding committee. The report was compiled by journalist Ajit Sahi and released and endorsed by Ramon Magsaysay Award-winner Sandeep Pandey, noted lawyer Prashant Bhushan, rights activists Teesta Setalvad and Apoorvanand, retired IPS officer SS Darapuri and JNU student leader Umar Khalid, who were present at the release of the document.When asked, Rahul Srivastava, PRO to UP DGP, refused to comment on the issue, saying, “Let them come to us in an official manner with detailed report of their investigation and then we will answer them point by point. But before that, I don't think the DGP’s office would like to get involved in something like that.”The report alleged that the police investigation was biased in favour of “a particular group” and alleged that police officers protected the majority community while unfairly targeting the minority community.According to police, the violence began after a group of Muslims obstructed a group of Hindus taking out a motorcycle procession, a ‘Tiranga Yatra’ to markRepublic Day, at Abdul Hameed Chowk in Kasganj city. One Chandan Gupta, who was in the procession, was allegedly killed by gunshot, after which dozens of people were injured and widespread vandalism and arson occurred in the district.

title: ‘Wish Sonia or Rahul had apologised for 1984 riots’
keywords: India, India news, India news today, Today news, Google news, Breaking news, Sonia Gandhi,Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh,Narendra Modi,manmohan singh,Kirron Kher,Indira Gandhi
content: NEW DELHI: BJP continued to target Congress over the 1984 riots, with MPKirron Kherchiding that the Gandhi family made former PMManmohan Singhapologise for the anti-Sikh pogrom than do so themselves, a charge that the principal opposition party rubbished as baseless.Intervening in a discussion in Rajya Sabha in 2005, then PM Singh had said he had seen statements of various leaders that he apologise. “I have no hesitation in apologising to the Sikh community. I apologise not only to the Sikh community, but to the whole Indian nation because what took place in 1984 is the negation of the concept of nationhood enshrined in our Constitution,” he had said.In a tweet, Kher said, “I wish Sonia or Rahul had apologised for the 1984 Sikh genocide, rather than making Manmohan Singh say it. Everyone knows the rioting mobs were led by Congressmen. Congress was led by the Gandhis, not Manmohan Singh.”In response, Congress spokesman Jaiveer Shergill said, “Kirron Kher, despite being an MP, is neither aware of facts nor reads the news.Sonia Gandhiand Manmohan Singh have already apologised for 1984 riots. As party vice president, Rahul Gandhi had underlined the PM and the Congress president had issued an apology, which was the Congress stand on the tragedy.”Speaking at the London School of Economics last week, Congress president Rahul Gandhi said, “When Manmohan Singh spoke, he spoke for all of us.”Shergill added, “Instead of playing opportunistic politics, Kher should ask PMNarendra Modito apologise for the 1984 riots as there are 30 RSS members named as accused in FIRs in riots cases.” He also asked why Modi had not apologised for the Gujarat riots in which his ministers and BJP leaders were allegedly involved and even convicted.

title: Wish Sonia or Rahul had apologised for 1984 riots: Kirron Kher
keywords: Chandigarh news, Chandigarh latest news, Chandigarh news live, Chandigarh news today, Today news Chandigarh, 1984 apology
content: New Delhi: BJP continued to target Congress over the 1984 riots, with MP Kirron Kher chiding that the Gandhi family made former PM Manmohan Singh apologise for the anti-Sikh pogrom than do so themselves, a charge that the principal opposition party rubbished as baseless.Intervening in a discussion in Rajya Sabha in 2005, then PM Singh had said he had seen statements of various leaders that he apologise. "I have no hesitation in apologising to the Sikh community. I apologise not only to the Sikh community, but to the whole Indian nation because what took place in 1984 is the negation of the concept of nationhood enshrined in our Constitution," he had said.Singh also said he had gone to the Golden Temple with Sonia Gandhi and prayed that such a tragedy never take place again.In a tweet, Kher said, “I wish Sonia or Rahul had apologised for the 1984 Sikh genocide, rather than making Manmohan Singh say it. Everyone knows the rioting mobs were led by Congressmen. Congress was led by the Gandhis, not Manmohan Singh.”Questioning the BJP leader’s claim, Congress spokesman Jaiveer Shergill said, “Kirron Kher, despite being an MP, is neither aware of facts nor reads the news. Sonia Gandhi and Manmohan Singh have already apologised for 1984 riots. As party vice-president, Rahul Gandhi had underlined that the PM and the Congress president had issued an apology which was the Congress stand on the tragedy.”Speaking at the London School of Economics last week, Congress president Rahul Gandhi said, “When Manmohan Singh spoke, he spoke for all of us. I am a victim of violence and I understand what it feels like. I condemn that 100%.”Shergill added, “Instead of playing opportunistic politics, Kher should ask PM Narendra Modi to apologise for the 1984 riots as there are 30 RSS members named as accused in FIRs in riots cases.” He also asked why Modi had not apologised for the Gujarat riots in which his ministers and BJP leaders were allegedly involved and even convicted.ends

title: Sikh riots issue generates heat in assembly
keywords: Chandigarh news, Chandigarh latest news, Chandigarh news live, Chandigarh news today, Today news Chandigarh, Sajjan Kumar,monsoon,Bikram Singh Majithia,Bhagat,amarinder singh
content: CHANDIGARH: The issue of Congress's alleged role in the 1984 Sikh riots generated heat on the second day of the ongoingmonsoonsession on Monday. After Akali MLABikram Singh Majithialed the attack on the Congress, chief ministerAmarinder Singhreiterated that the party was not connected with the violence and any involvement of a few Congress leaders could have been only at an individual level. The issue had come back to the fore after Congress national chief Rahul Gandhi said in the UK that the Congress was not involved in the anti-Sikh riots.Even as Akali leaders indulged in sloganeering and staged a walkout, Amarinder said that the Majithia must have been in a pram when the riots took place and had no knowledge about the issue at all.The former minister raised the issue of Rahul Gandhi's recent statement on the 1984 riots in the House, to which Amarinder responded with a strong missive to the Akali leader not to indulge in falsehoods.Amarinder told mediapersons later that Majithia was just about eight years old at the time of the riots and was probably in a pram. What does he know about the issue, asked Amarinder, warning the Akalis against playing with the sentiments of the Sikhs on the sensitive matter.Earlier, reiterating his stand on the issue in the House, Amarinder said he had personally visited relief camps immediately after the incident and met people there.People in the camps had named some individual Congress leaders, like H K LBhagat,Sajjan Kumar, Arjan Das and Dharamdas Shastri, which he had subsequently revealed to the public, said Amarinder."I have been naming these people for the past almost 34 years," said the CM, adding that he had named the people who were mentioned to him, and not out of any personal knowledge.

title: Two get life term for leading mob, pouring petrol into S-6 coach
keywords: Ahmedabad news, Ahmedabad latest news, Ahmedabad news live, Ahmedabad news today, Today news Ahmedabad, SIT,riot,Prajapati,High Court of Gujarat,godhra
content: AHMEDABAD: A specialSITcourt on Monday held two persons guilty and awarded them life imprisonment while it acquitted three others in connection with theGodhratrain carnage, in which 59 passengers returning from Ayodhya were killed in the S-6 coach of the Sabarmati Express on February 27, 2002.These five accused had been absconding for more than a decade and were not present for the trial when the court delivered verdict against 94 persons in 2011. They were arrested in 2015-16 by various agencies and put on a trial.After conducting the trial against these five persons in Sabarmati Central Jail, Godhra’s additional sessions judge, H C Vora, sentenced Imran alias Sheru Bhatuk (37) and Faruk Bana (57) to life imprisonment for their role in the carnage.Three persons – Hussain Suleman Mohan, Kasam Bhamedi and Faruk Dhantiya were exonerated for want of evidence.Another accused person, Kadir Patiliya, had been arrested in this case but he died due to cardiac arrest in Sabarmati Central Jail in January.According to special prosecutor N NPrajapati, Bhana was an elected member of the Godhra municipality in 2002. He has been convicted for leading a violent mob, for instigation and assault on passengers.Bhatuk had a role in the conspiracy as well. He was present at the meeting at Aman Guest House and when the train arrived, Bhana took a carboy full of flammable liquid from Razzak Kurkur’s house, put it on a vehicle and brought it to the S-6 coach.He was among three persons who got into the bogie and poured the liquid fuel inside after Shaukat Lalo opened the door from the inside of the coach.The prosecution demanded the death sentence for the duo, claiming this was the “rarest of the rare” case and the SIT court in 2011 handed down the death penalty to 11 convicts in this case.The state government has filed an appeal before the Supreme Court against Gujarat high court’s decision to reduce the capital punishment to life imprisonment.The killing of 59 karsevaks in the train near Godhra railway station sparked communal riots across the state, which led to the loss of more than 1,000 lives over the next three months.

content: 'Yamla Pagla Deewana Phir Se' sees the Deols –Dharmendra, Sunny and Bobby - reuniting on the big screen after a gap of five years.
