title: Police chowky and cars torched, 75 vehicles damaged in rioting
keywords: Mumbai news, Mumbai latest news, Mumbai news live, Mumbai news today, Today news Mumbai, Molotov Cocktail,mankhurd,Kopar Khairane
content: MUMBAI: The bandh called by the Maratha Kranti Morcha may not have caused much disruption in Mumbai, but it resulted in largescale violence and arson in Navi Mumbai and Thane. The violence in Kalamboli and Koparkhairane, in particular, in Navi Mumbai continued till late evening, despite the umbrella organisation of Maratha groups having called off its shutdown at 3pm.A mob attacked a police chowky in Koparkhairne and damaged furniture. Earlier in the day, on the Sion-Panvel highway, near Kalamboli, agitators torched a police jeep and damaged a riot control van. Police opened fire in the air as stone-pelting protesters blocked traffic on the Pune Expressway.Cops also used teargas and lathicharge to disperse a mob at Nitin junction in Thane which, armed with rods, was intimidating motorists and forcibly emptying buses and autorickshaws. Crowds burnt tyres at traffic junctions and damaged vehicles in Vashi, Ghansoli, Airoli, Kamothe and Kharghar in Navi Mumbai.Though life in Mumbai’s suburbs was affected to some extent, south Mumbai was largely unaffected. AtMankhurd, a mob hurled Molotov cocktails at a BEST bus, burning its seats and breaking its panes and the windscreen, sources said. Nobody was hurt.In Mumbai, schools and colleges remained open and offices saw full attendance. However, children were asked to get off a school bus in Koparkhairne and another school with branches in Gorai and Kandivli was shut after its buses were stopped and drivers threatened.

title: 1984 anti-Sikh riots the biggest case of mob lynching: Rajnath Singh
keywords: India, India news, India news today, Today news, Google news, Breaking news, Sushma Swaraj,Rajnath singh lynching,Rajnath Singh,Mob lynching,Mallikarjun Kharge,Lok Sabha no confidence motion
content: NEW DELHI: Addressing the issue of mob lynchings in the country, Union home ministerRajnath Singhreminded the House of the 1984 anti-Sikh riots."I would like tell people who are raising these issues that the biggest case ofmob lynchinghappened during 1984 Sikh genocide," the minister said during the debate on no-confidence motion in the Lok Sabha.Condemning the incidents of mob lynching, the minister said his ministry has advised the states to take stringent action against the culprits as also social media service providers to install checks to stop the spread of rumours and fake news.Singh was responding in the Lok Sabha during the Zero Hour to Congress leader KC Venugopal, who raised the issue of lynching, last week's attack on Swami Agnivesh in Jharkhand and trolling of External Affairs MinisterSushma Swaraj.Singh said several people have been killed in the lynching incidents and added that it was a matter of grave concern for the government.He said that the lynching happened because of rumours and unverified or fake news.While observing that law and order is a state subject, Singh said the Centre cannot, however, remain silent on the issue."I have issued advisories to state government in 2016 and 2018. We have asked social media service providers to install check. Such incidents are unfortunate. We have asked the Chief Ministers to take firm action against the culprits," Singh said.Raising the issue, Venugopal regretted that while these mob lynching and physical attacks on people, including those with dissenting views, have become the order of the day, the government was maintaining a silence.He said that Union Minister Jayant Sinha had even garlanded some people who were allegedly involved in mob lynching incidents."Is this the rule of the law? These are very serious issues. I request the government to secure the democratic environment of the country," he said.He also alleged that the government was using investigating agencies to "target people"."I urge upon the government to make a law to prevent mob lynching," he said, advising ministers not to garland convicts.Noisy scenes were witnessed during the discussion on the subject with some BJP members protesting Venugopal's speech, as Kharge and Jyotiraditya Scindia were seen vociferously asking the Chair to allow the Congress MP to complete his submission, saying it was a serious matter concerning the nation.Not satisfied with the response of the home minister, Congress members led byMallikarjun Khargestaged a walkout expressing dissatisfaction.(With inputs from PTI)

title: In a trial of errors, court frees four riot accused twice!
keywords: Ahmedabad news, Ahmedabad latest news, Ahmedabad news live, Ahmedabad news today, Today news Ahmedabad, saeed rangrez,riots,Muslim Rangrez,mehbub shaikh,jamilkhan pathan,Double jeopardy
content: AHMEDABAD: In a rare instance, four persons accused in cases pertaining to the 2002riotswere arrested after being exonerated in the same case by Ahmedabad sessions court. What’s more, they almost faced the trial for the second time but were eventually spared thedouble jeopardythanks to the judge who remembered having acquitted them earlier. The four finally walked free but not before spending a week in jail due to the goof-up by courts.According to the case details, a Muslim mob targeted an autorickshaw near the Asarwa flyover on February 28, 2002. Five persons — Imamuddin Shaikh,Saeed Rangrez,Jamilkhan Pathan, Ahmed Rangrez andMehbub Shaikh— were charged with arson, rioting and attempt to murder. The chargesheet remained with the magisterial court for almost seven years.Of the five accused, only Mehbub Shaikh attended court proceedings while four others did not respond to court warrants. On December 24, 2008, a metropolitan court delinked Mehbub’s case from the rest and ordered Madhavpura police to file a separate chargesheet against the other four accused. It sent only Mehbub’s case to the sessions court for trial.It so happened that additional sessions judge Nipa Rawal issued summons to all five accused instead of Mehbub alone.They appeared before the sessions court and the trial against them took place. All of them were acquitted on January 25 this year for want of evidence.Meanwhile, on the directions of metropolitan court, Madhavpura police filed a separate chargesheet against the four accused in the same case. The magistrate issued warrants against them in February. They were arrested in the first week of March and produced before the metropolitan court.Bail order left jail authorities confusedEverybody was confused. We told the court that all four accused in the separate chargesheet were already acquitted in this case by a sessions court. But the magisterial court had a new chargesheet, which it had not committed to the sessions court,” said advocate R J Solanki, who appeared for the accused. The four then moved a bail application. “When we finally convinced the metropolitan court, the issue of jurisdiction came up as the sessions court has power to grant bail in such cases,” said Solanki.The case again reached the sessions judge who had acquitted all the accused just a month ago. She recollected the case and immediately granted bail on March 7. She also sought an explanation from the police about the second chargesheet in the case. “When we gave the bail order to the jail authorities, it left them confused. We had to go back to the court to obtain proper directions. Until the air was cleared, the accused had to remain behind bars,” the advocate said.As if this was not enough, the metropolitan court committed the new chargesheet against four accused to the sessions court for trial. However, the sessions court quickly decided that no further order was required in this case and put a full stop to it on March 15.

title: Painting and craft exhibition brings a riot of colours
keywords: Varshman kala Ashram,saket,Painting,krishna,ganesha
content: Bringing on one platform the varied art forms of painting and craft items, a two day painting exhibition was organized on Saturday andSundayat theSaketcommunity hall of the city by artists from the city. Students and patrons ofVarshman Kala Ashramshowcased their talents in abstract, figurative, landscapes and other styles of paintings.While some of the participating artists were pursuing a course in fine arts, others displayed their work created as a hobby. A total of 60 art works were showcased by 30 artists. Among them were paintings of Gods including Radha Krishna paintings, Lord Ganesha’s paintings etc. Craft work had also been exhibited in the show including flowers made using tissue papers, glass painting and paper quilling art.

title: Riot-like security for constable exam
keywords: Jaipur news, Jaipur latest news, Jaipur news live, Jaipur news today, Today news Jaipur, rajasthan,Mobile phone,mobile Internet,examination center,Constable exam
content: JAIPUR:Mobile internetservices were suspended and high-alert security remained clamped acrossRajasthanin an unprecedented security arrangement for the two-day examination for 13,142 constable posts that began on Saturday.Over 14 lakh candidates — seven lakh on Saturday and a similar number on the next day — are taking the test at 644 centres in a “riot-ready” security atmosphere even as people vented their ire for being not able to use mobile internet services. The arrangement was in response to the “organised cheating” witnessed in the same examination conducted in March this year which was subsequently scrapped. Jaipur city, where 209 examination centres have been set up, was most affected by the ‘digital curfew’ as many could not book cabs, check online status of their trains, buses or flights.‘Shops shut due to fear of rampage’Many shops remained closed fearing rampage by the huge crowd of young people in the city.“The last time I faced such an ordeal was in September last year when there was tension in Ramganj and internet was suspended. I had to catch a train but couldn’t book a cab to reach the station. I had to call up my cousin in Delhi to book the cab and check the train status,” said Sarita Sharma, a Jaipur resident.Cheating mafias had rigged an earlier test held in March this year, forcing the state to scrap the exam and hold it once again. A relentless operation, which began two weeks ago, to nab the cheating gangs resulted in the arrest of nearly 50 suspects. They were involved in “helping” candidates by arranging impersonators and providing question papers before the test.So, the police department walked the extra mile this time around to assure a “cheating-free” recruitment process even though it amounted to “high-handedness” that caused large-scale disruption in internet communication.

title: Giriraj Singh meets riot accused Bajrang Dal, VHP workers in Bihar's Nawada Jail
keywords: India, India news, India news today, Today news, Google news, Breaking news, Vishva Hindu Parishad,Rama Navami,Nawada jail,Nawada,Giriraj Singh,bajrang dal
content: NAWADA: Union ministerGiriraj Singhon Saturday metBajrang DalandVishva Hindu Parishadworkers, who are currently inNawada jailof Bihar on the accusations of rioting.The meeting lasted for 30 minutes, where Singh inquired about their well-being.The Union Minister expressed his grief over the arrest of the activists saying that they were framed."It is unfortunate the way Jitu Ji and Kailash Ji have been framed. When tension arose during Ram Navami in 2017, they resumed peace in the area. They did the same when an idol of goddess Durga was vandalised in Akbarpur."Singh further accused the State government of having a mindset of suppressing Hindus for communal harmony."It is very saddening to see that the government feels that communal harmony will be there only if they suppress Hindus. I request the State government and the society to let go of this kind of attitude," said Singh.Appealing to the people for communal harmony, Singh said, "I do now want arrests, I just want social harmony."On July 3, Bajrang Dal convenor Jitendra Pratap was arrested for the riots in 2017. On July 4, the supporters of Pratap protested against the arrest and took to the streets, which led to the arrest of five people.Even as Sinha was being condemned for his garland gesture, Union minister Giriraj Singh created another controversy when he met Bajrang Dal and Vishva Hindu Parishad workers, who are currently in Nawada jail of Bihar on the accusations of rioting.The meeting lasted for 30 minutes, where Singh inquired about their well-being. The Union Minister expressed his grief over the arrest of the activists saying that they were framed.

title: After Jayant Sinha, Giriraj meets riot accused, flays Nitish government
keywords: India, India news, India news today, Today news, Google news, Breaking news, Vishva Hindu Parishad,Sikh,Rama Navami,Nawada district,jharkhand,Bihar,bajrang dal
content: PATNA: A day after his cabinet colleague Jayant Sinha had drawn flak for felicitating eight cow vigilantes convicted of killing a meat trader inJharkhand, Union minister and BJP's Nawada MP Giriraj Singh stoked another controversy by visiting theNawada districtjail and meetingBajrang Daland VHP members recently arrested for allegedly inflaming communal passions.Alliance partner JD(U) was quick to criticise Giriraj's jail visit on Saturday, where he praised the arrested activists for their "role in maintaining peace" and accused the Nitish Kumar government of implicating them accused in "false cases"."It is very unfortunate that the state government feels communal harmony will be maintained only if it suppresses Hindus. I request the government and the society to let go of this kind of perception," the minister said.JD(U) dismissed Giriraj's charges on Sunday and condemned his meeting with the riot accused in jail. In Delhi, JD(U) national secretary general KC Tyagi said the Union minister's meeting with the riot accused couldn't be condoned in a "healthy democracy".Taking strong exception to Giriraj's remark about Hindus being "suppressed" by the administration in Bihar, Tyagi said, "Be it Hindu, Muslim, Sikh or Christian, they all are safer inBiharthan in any other part of the country. Such comments increase tension in society."Giriraj had met the riot accused for 30 minutes and inquired about their health and families. After the meeting, he had said that the men had been framed."It is unfortunate the way Jitu ji and Kailash ji have been framed. When tension arose during Ram Navami in 2017, they worked to restore peace in the area. They did the same work when an idol of Goddess Durga was vandalised at Akbarpur in Nawada district," Giriraj told reporters outside the jail.Bajrang Dal leader Jitendra Pratap was arrested on July 3 for his alleged role in the riots in 2017. On July 4, his supporters took to the streets, which led to the arrest of five others.Unmoved by the criticism, Giriraj on Sunday met the family of a man accused of engineering clashes in Nawada in March this year. There too, he said the accused had maintained peace at the time of crisis. He urged the district administration to conduct a "thorough investigation" and called for a speedy trial in the case.

title: Rioting charge on 23 for waste-dumping protest
keywords: Noida news, Noida latest news, Noida news live, Noida news today, Today news Noida, waste-dumping protest,surajpur,Rioting charge,Mubarakpur,garbage dumping
content: NOIDA: The Noida Authority seems to be in no mood to relent over the garbage issue any more. On Friday, officials reiterated the Authority will clean the city’s garbage and dump it at the Mubarkpur village site over the next week. Meanwhile, police have slapped various cases, including that of rioting, on 23 protesters arrested on Thursday.Rajesh Singh, the officer on special duty to Noida Authority, said that the city “generates 600 tonnes of solid waste every day”. “The workers have started picking up garbage from sectors and dumping them at theMubarakpursite. We are storing the garbage scientifically and also spraying medicines to ensure they do not stink. We hope to clean the city of garbage in one week,” he told TOI.Police said the 23 people arrested on Thursday for protesting against the dumping ground in Mubarakpur village have been charged with serious charges of rioting, obstructing public servants from discharging duty, threat of injury of public servants, wrongful consignment, voluntarily causing hurt, intentional insult to provoke breach of peace and criminal intimidation.Manoj Kumar Pant, SHO ofSurajpurpolice station, said cases were registered against the accused, including local Congress functionary Raghuraj Singh, following a complaint by the Noida Authority. The complaint says that sanitation workers had stopped collecting garbed from sectors for the last five days over the confusion over waste site. “There was fear about public outburst. Due to monsoon season, there is also a high chance of vector borne diseases due to garbage,” it says.According to the FIR, Noida Authority decided to store the solid waste at the site but a group of around 70-80 people armed with sticks and canes reached the spot and damaged the plastic sheet which was spread on the ground for garbage disposal.“Some protesting members also climbed over the earthmovers and halted the work. They also threatened the workers that they would be dumped on the spot if they dump garbage at the site. Some had even manhandled the sanitation workers,” the FIR says.Though Raghuraj Singh and five others were released on bail from the police station, 17 others have been sent to 14-day judicial custody. Satish Khari, a local resident, said residents of the area would hold a meeting on Saturday and decide the further course of action.

title: ‘Teach children about Godhra riots and Emergency’
keywords: Goa news, Goa latest news, Goa news live, Goa news today, Today news Goa, Indira Gandhi,Congress,BJP,2013 Muzaffarnagar riots,2002 gujarat violence
content: PANAJI: Responding to calls from within theBJPranks and by BJP alliance partner Goa Forward Party (GFP) for a chapter on the Emergency to be included in school curriculum, theCongresson Thursday said that a chapter on the Godhra riots, Muzaffarnagar riots and other communal issues should also be part of history textbooks.“The Emergency was an unfortunate decision by theIndira Gandhigovernment. However, if a chapter on the Emergency should be included in the school curriculum then why not a chapter on the Godhra riots and the Muzaffarnagar riots?” Congress spokesperson Jitendra Deshprabhu said.Deshprabhu asked why GFP president Vijai Sardesai was not speaking out against the BJP’s current rule in the country. “Vijai is talking about a declared emergency but he is not speaking about today’s undeclared emergency.”The former MLA also took a dig at GFP by saying that the party had betrayed its voters by joining hands with the BJP post the 2017 state assembly elections.

title: Police summon former BJP leader in June 16 rioting case
keywords: Vadodara news, Vadodara latest news, Vadodara news live, Vadodara news today, Today news Vadodara, Rajput,Nyay Mandir,Maharana Pratap,Division (military)
content: VADODARA: Former BJP leader Dharmendrasinh Vaghela was summoned by police in connection with the communal riots that broke when a procession was organized by theRajputKarni Sena on June 16. Rioting had broken out when the procession reached Dudhwala Mohalla nearNyay Mandir. Mobs from both communities had pelted each other with stones.Vaghela, who had contested the 2017 assembly polls as an independent candidate from Waghodia, had attended the procession held to celebrate the birth anniversary ofMaharana Pratap. “Vaghela attended the procession so we have sent him a notice asking him to give his statement within seven days. We want to know his role in the procession and if he was present when the trouble began near Dudhwala Mohalla,” said S G Patil, ACP (E division).Police had booked the accused for criminal conspiracy and rioting and have arrested 10 persons, includes the organizers of the procession. The cops had said that a section of the procession had broken away and took another road to Dudhwala Mohalla.

title: Thane: Nine held for rioting, assault on police personnel
keywords: Thane news, Thane latest news, Thane news live, Thane news today, Today news Thane, Ulhasnagar,rioting,Nine held,assault on police personnel
content: THANE: Nine persons, including three brothers, have been arrested on the charges ofriotingand assaulting police personnel at Central Police Station inUlhasnagarin the district, an official said on Tuesday.The incident took place on Monday when an estranged couple came to the counselling centre at the police station along with their relatives. The counselling centres at the police stations try to mediate between warring couples."When the couple was being counselled, an argument broke out between their relatives present there. Some members from both the sides exchanged blows," Thane police spokesperson Sukhada Narkar said."The policemen and the mediator present there tried to pacify the warring members, but they were also beaten up," she said.Members of both the groups also took out knives, but the police managed to overpower them. Soon, more police personnel and beat marshals arrived at the station and caught nine of the accused, the official said adding that as many members managed to flee."The woman constable and the mediator sustained injuries in the incident and they are undergoing treatment at a hospital here," Narkar said.The arrested accused were identified as Samir Changle (24), Sachin Murtadkar (21), Yogesh Murtadkar (24), Rahul Murtadkar (26) (all brothers), Mahesh Karpe (36), Vikas Shirsar (26), Akash Shirsat (24), Bandu Shirsat (36) and Amol Shirsat (28), police said.They have been booked under various IPC sections including, section 353 (assault or criminal force to deter public servant from discharge of his duty), 332 (voluntarily causing hurt to deter public servant from his duty), 452 (house-trespass after preparation for hurt, assault or wrongful restraint), 147 (rioting), 148 (rioting, armed with deadly weapon) and 506 (criminal intimidation).They have also been booked under the Arms Act and section 7 of the Criminal Law (Amendment) Act, police said adding that a search has been launched to nab the other accused.

title: A laughter riot on stage
keywords: theatre,Ranga Shankara,Moog Masala,comedy
content: KriyativeTheatre, a group which believes in combiningcomedywith artistic excellence and social concern, has come up with yet another wholesome entertainer. Their brand new comedy,Moog Masalais sure to have you rolling in splits of laughter. The play, directed by Joseph, (director of popular comedies likeRatnan ParpanchaandGundayanaby the same group) is based on a short story written by the famous Malayalam writer, Vaikom Mohammed Bashir.The play revolves around a variety of responses to a man’s nose. You have to see the play to believe the infinite possibilities of what a long nose can represent and the ways in which it can impact the lives of different people.The play – featuring artistes Laxmi Chandrashekar and Surabhi Vasist – is scheduled to take place atRanga Shankaraon July 5, 7 pm.

title: Owaisi wants BJP to remember Gujarat riots, Babri demolition also
keywords: India, India news, India news today, Today news, Google news, Breaking news, emergency,BJP,Babri Mosque,Asaduddin Owaisi,2002 gujarat violence
content: HYDERABAD: Taking a swipe at theBJPover 43rd anniversary of imposition ofemergency, AIMIM presidentAsaduddin Owaisisaid the party should also remember other events such as the assassination of Mahatma Gandhi, Gujarat riots, and demolition of the Babri masjid."BJP is remembering Emergency after 43 years and I hope, I expect that they will live up to the responsibility of remembering 2002 Gujarat, they will remember December 6 demolition of Babri masjid and also the genocide of Sikhs and the assassination of father of the nation Mahatma Gandhi," he told reporters here.He also alleged there was an "undeclared emergency" under the present NDA rule.Charging both the Congress and the BJP with failure to deliver the goods, he said regional parties would play an important role after the 2019 Lok Sabha polls.On his reported comments that Muslims should vote for Muslim candidates, Owaisi said wanted his party candidates, who also included non-Muslims, to be successful and he asked Muslims to take part in politics.Observing that number of Muslim candidates contesting elections was coming down, he claimed that Muslim political marginalisation is taking place as per a conspiracy."BJP does not give tickets to Muslims. Congress is also doing janeudharu politics' now. As per a deliberate conspiracy, Muslim political marginalisation is taking place... that is why I said you (Muslims) participate in politics," he added.

title: Rioting reported in Vadodara's Nyay Mandir area
keywords: Vadodara news, Vadodara latest news, Vadodara news live, Vadodara news today, Today news Vadodara, Yakutpura,Nyay Mandir,Maharana Pratap,Gujarat Riots,eid
content: VADODARA: Communal clashes erupted nearNyay Mandirin old city area late on Saturday evening during a procession to mark the birth anniversary ofMaharana Pratap. Police had to lob tear gas shells near Dudhwala Mohalla in the area to disperse the mob.According to police, when the procession was passing by Dudhwala Mohalla, some mischief monger pelted a stone at the procession. Within minutes, the situation turned ugly as people from the rally too started to pelt stones at the crowd there on the occasion ofEid. Mobs gathered on either side and the stone pelting continued for some time. Several cars parked outside Nyay Mandir were damaged.As the police learnt about the situation, it reached there in large numbers to contain the situation. Besides lobbing tear gas shells, police also resorted to mild lathicharge to disperse the mob. However, the exact number of tear gas shells lobbed was not known.The news of the clash soon spread in the walled city area because of which people living in communally sensitive area ofYakutpuraand Fatehpura came out on roads. “People had gathered on roads, but we controlled the situation. There was no incident of stone pelting in those areas,” said joint commissioner of police, KG Bhati. He added that no persons were injured in the clashes.After the situation was brought under the control, police remained deployed in the area in a large number to avoid any aggravation of situation.

title: City comedians created a laughter riot at the event
keywords: Stand-up comedy,Red Panda Comedy Club,homegrown,comedians,Aurangabad, Maharashtra
content: Back with their second season, thecomediansof Red Panda club in Aurangabad made everyone laugh at the hilarious performances. Started with a motive of just promoting art, these youngsters have come a long way to perform it again. The evening burst into laughter as ten comedians from the city put forth their art of making the audience laugh. The club had successfully brought together a set ofhomegrownstand up artists who were not shy of taking on the stage. Seasoned artists, along with a few new performers, left the audience in a fit of giggles. All their laughter buds were satisfied and no one left dissatisfied.

title: Young artist Khushi Morani showcases a riot of colours at her debut art exhibition in Jaipur
keywords: khushi morani,Jawahar Kala Kendra,jaipur girl khushi morani,art exhibition at jawahar kala kendra,art exhibition
content: Jaipur-based artistKhushi Morani's art exhibition-cum-sale titled Ibtida-The Beginning was inaugurated at Parijat-II art gallery ofJawahar Kala Kendraon Friday. As many as 24 artworks, including 17 paintings and 7 sketches have been displayed at the art gallery.One of the visitors at the exhibitionKhushi, who is a student of class 12, has used techniques such as acrylic, watercolour, oilcolour, andmixed media in her paintings. Right from modern art to musical instruments, animals, spirituality, Khushi's exhibition covers it all.The young lass says that she made the most of her summer vacations this time and prepared all the artworks that she has displayed. "This is the first time that I am putting up an exhibition and I am really excited. The main aim of my exhibition is to get employment-oriented education to underprivileged girls of our society. The money collected from the sale of these artworks will be given to a Jaipur-based school which works towards the upliftment of such girls and makes them stand on their feet," says Khushi.

title: Four held for rioting in Sarthana
keywords: Surat news, Surat latest news, Surat news live, Surat news today, Today news Surat, SMIMER Hospital,Gujarat,financial dispute,Alang
content: SURAT: Police rounded up four persons after two groups clashed over afinancial disputein the city on Thursday. One person was seriously injured and was admitted toSMIMER hospital.After cross complaints were filed by both parties, Sarthana police officials said that a group of people, including Raju Bharwad and Raju Rathod, were sitting at a plywood shop ‘Mahadev Alang’ at Diamond Nagar in Laskana village on Thursday. They called Dhiru Jetani, a resident of Sudaman Chowk, Mota Varachha, to the shop and said they had given a supari (assassination contract) to eliminate his brother Raju Jetani.Dhiru Jetani denied having done any such thing and told them to go away. According to Jetani, Bharwad and Rathod then demanded Rs 50,000 as protection money from him.On his refusal to pay and telling them to stay calm, Bharwad slapped Vijay Mangukia, who was with Jetani and threatened them with a stick.Bharwad’s complaint states that Jetani, the owner of MahadevAlang, his relatives Mahesh, Ravji and Vijay Mangukia got agitated when a money issue was discussed. Bharwad was hit on head by one of the accused, who is now being treated at SMIMER hospital.Police registered a complaint under Sections 323, 385, 504, 506, 452, 143, 147 and 149 of the IPC and Section 135 of theGujaratPolice Act. The second complaint is registered under the IPC Sections 307, 323, 504, 506, 114 and Section 135 of the Gujarat Police Act.A police official said, “It looks to be a case involving some financial dealing. However, both parties are hiding facts from the police. Once we speak to the injured person in a day or two, things will become clear. We arrested Dhiru Jetani, Mahesh, Ravji and Vijay late on Thursday and will produce them in court in the evening.”

title: Motorcycle parking sparks riot in Godhra
keywords: Vadodara news, Vadodara latest news, Vadodara news live, Vadodara news today, Today news Vadodara, pulled rickshaw,Motorcycle parking sparks riot in Godhra,khadi falia,godhra
content: VADODARA: Rioting took place between members of different communities in theKhadi Falialocality inGodhratown late on Friday. The incident took place after a petty quarrel over a wrongly parked motorcycle in the area.Members of two different communities live in nearby narrow lanes in the area. In the past too, tension has been witnessed in the area. On Friday night, a man resident of the area parked his motorcycle in a manner that it was on the street.A rickshaw driver living in the area was passing by and objected to the motorcycle being parked at the site. This led to a quarrel that snowballed into a riot with mobs pelting stones at each other.Police teams from various police stations in Godhra rushed to the spot and brought the situation under control. Three teargas shells were lobbed by the police to contain the violence.Deputy superintendent of police R I Desai said that the situation was immediately brought under control and policemen were vigilant in the area. Cross complaints were registered regarding the incident by Godhra police. In all, the offences mention the names of 34 persons and mobs of 40 to 50 persons on either side.

title: A laughter riot on stage
keywords: theatre,Saladallondu Samsara,Ramakrishna,Kengal Hanumanthaih Kala Soudha
content: The protagonist of the play,Saladallondu Samsara,is a middle-class domestic man. He is immersed with innumerable debts, and it is impossible for a man like him to make both ends meet in a family and come out of the neck-deep debts. But this clever man continues to get loans from each and everybody he meets and even from his old lenders. These situations give enough room for extensive comedy, which will make the audience roar with laughter.The cast of the play includes artistes Partha Sarathy K, Prashan Rippunpet, Babu Kumar, Raghavendra, Ramakrishna, Manjunath and Shanthala Karanth.Saladallondu Samsarais scheduled to take place atKengal Hanumanthaih Kala Soudhaon June 16 (7 pm).

title: Bhima Koregaon riots: Cops release videos of 4 persons assaulting youth
keywords: Pune news, Pune latest news, Pune news live, Pune news today, Today news Pune, Video footage,rahul phatangade,Kanur Mesai,crime investigation department,Bhima Koregaon Violence
content: PUNE: Video grabs of four people seen assaulting a youth during theBhima Koregaon violencethat occurred on January 1 was released by the Maharashtra Police'sCrime Investigation Departmenton Friday.Rahul Phatangade(30) a resident ofKanur Mesai, was attacked and killed by a mob, armed with stones and sticks, near Sanaswadi during the Bhima Koregaon violence on January 1.Pune (Rural) police has already arrested three people in connection with Phatangade's death. The case was taken over by the state CID in February."During investigations, we recoveredvideo footagein which a large mob is seen assaulting Phatangade with sticks and stones. We managed to identify four more assailants," said Akkanouru Prasad Pralhad, Superintendent of Police, CID, Pune Unit."We are yet to ascertain the identity of the four people seen in the video. Therefore we are releasing the grabs of these suspects and also the complete video footage of a frenzied mob assaulting Phatangade," said Pralhad.He appealed to people to come forward and help the police with information that would lead to the arrest of the four persons seen in the video grabs.Violence erupted on January 1, allegedly due to provocative speeches made at the Elgar Parishad, organised at Pune's Shaniwarwada on December 31, to commemorate 200 years of the Bhima Koregaon battle in 1818.One person was killed and vehicles and houses were damaged in the violence.

title: Muzaffarnagar riots: Court rejects SIT’s clean chit to 6 accused in Kawal murder
keywords: Meerut news, Meerut latest news, Meerut news live, Meerut news today, Today news Meerut, special investigation team,muzaffarnagar,Mohammed Waseem,Kawal,Ankur Sharma
content: MUZAFFARNAGAR: In a twist toKawalvillage murder case, which had triggered large-scale riots inMuzaffarnagarin 2013, a local court on Tuesday trashed the clean chit given bySpecial Investigation Team(SIT) to the six accused and directed them to surrender before it.Shahnawaz, 25, was stabbed to death on August 27, 2013 in Kawal village, allegedly by a group of eight persons in a group clash. Soon after the murder, a crowd caught two of the attackers and lynched them. Remaining six accused had managed to escape. Later, cross FIRs were registered in the two separate cases of murders. The three killings flared up communal tension and led to large-scale riots in Muzaffarnagar and adjoining districts in the months of August and September, 2103. At least 63 people lost their lives and over 50,000 were displaced.The SIT, which was set up by the state government to probe the riots cases, gave a clean chit to the six persons accused in the murder of Shahnawaz. While the probe agency filed a charge-sheet in the second case, in which two youths were lynched by mob in Kawal village.However, in a fresh turn of events, additional chief judicial magistrate (ACJM)Ankur Sharmarejected the SIT’s clean chit and asked the six accused – Prahlad, Vishan, Devender, Jitendra, Yogender and Ravinder – to be present before it on July 10.“I lodged a protest in the court against the clean chit given to six persons, who are accused of killing Shahnawaz. After hearing both the sides, the ACJM’s court rejected the clean chit and asked all the accused to surrender on July 10,” said Mohsin Zaidi, a lawyer representing the victim.The magistrate was hearing a private complaint filed byMohammed Waseem, the father of Shahnawaz. Waseem had challenged the SIT’s closure report, which had exonerated the six accused in the case.

title: Life gradually limping back to normal in Shillong
keywords: Shillong news, Shillong latest news, Shillong news live, Shillong news today, Today news Shillong, Sikh,Shillong,Shattered Peace,riots,Khasi Hills,district
content: SHILLONG: The situation was returning to normal in trouble-tornShillongand curfew relaxed for nine hours on Friday, a week after assault of local boys and subsequent clashes between protesters and security forcesshattered peacein the hill station.Curfew was relaxed for nine hours on Friday in the 14 affected areas of the state capital from 7 am to 4 pm with no incident of violence reported during the curfew hours for the fourth day on Friday, EastKhasi Hillsdeputy commissioner P S Dkhar said."The situation has returned to normal. Life and business is back as you can see around. Markets and taxis are plying normally," he said.In rest of the city, curfew will be in force from 8 pm to 5 am as a preventive measure, he said.The Meghalaya capital had been in the grip of violence since last week following clashes between local tribals and Punjabi residents.The curfew at Punjabi Lane and in 13 other affected areas will be resumed at 4 pm as a precautionary measure, he said."We do not want the situation to relapse," he said, adding that heavy security forces have been deployed in vulnerable areas.Messaging services had been restored briefly on Thursday and authorities would decide whether mobile telephone services would be allowed, he said.The state capital had been in the grip of violence following the assault of a bus handyman and his two friends by Sikh residents in Punjabi Lane area of the city.Thedistrictauthorities had ordered a magisterial inquiry headed by I Majaw to probe the incident and to identify rumour mongers inciting violence.A high-level committee was also formed by the Meghalaya Democratic Alliance government to find a permanent solution to the issue of relocation of the Sweeper Colony, inhabited by Punjabis.

title: 'Yamla Pagla Deewana Phir Se' teaser: This ride with the Deols is a laugh riot
keywords: Sunny Deol,salman khan,Rana Ranbir,Kriti Kharbanda,Johnny Lever,Dharmendra,Bobby Deol,Binnu Dhillon
content: As per the announcement made by the makers of the third instalment of the 'Yamla Pagla Deewana' series, they have finally launched the teaser of 'Yamla Pagla Deewana Phir Se' after revealing the individual posters ofDharmendra, Sunny andBobby Deol.The film which brings back the Deol trio on-screen once more together in this laugh riot looks like a comic caper, just like its previous hit instalments. The stars took to introduce themselves on social media with witty captions which raised the expectations from the trailer and the makers haven't disappointed as the Deol camaraderie is entertaining.The trailer also shows us a new storyline with new characters essayed by Dharmendra, Sunny and Bobby which has surely raised expectations from this third instalment. But the highlight of the teaser isSalman Khan's cameo as Mastana which has added more star value to the film.'Yamla Pagla Deewana Phir Se' which is helmed by Navaniat Singh also starsKriti Kharbanda,Binnu Dhillon,Johnny Lever, Gurmeet Saajan andRana Ranbirin pivotal roles and is scheduled to release on August 15, 2018.FacebookTwitterPintrest

title: ‘Abar Basanta Bilap’ trailer promises a laugh riot
keywords: Paran Bandyopadhyay,Munmun Sen,Kharaj Mukherjee,Bengali,Abar Basanta Bilap
content: The 1973 hit ‘Basanta Bilap’ made people roll on the floor laughing back then. Now, yet another film by the name, ‘Abar Basanta Bilap’ is all set to hit the theatres on July 13, 2018. The trailer of the film has just been released and we can’t stop laughing loud after watching it. Check out the video here:In the film, noted actorsParan BandyopadhyayandKharaj Mukherjeework as the manager and proof-readers of a press respectively. The story will revolve around the daily struggle of this press named Basanta Bilap. To add a twist to the narrative,Munmun Sen, playing a successful entrepreneur, comes to the press to publish her new book and the laugh riot starts here as Paran and Kharaj’s characters try to win Munmun’s heart at the same time. Mir will also be seen in a funny role in ‘Abar Basanta Bilap’. He is playing the role of Dimpi who apparently is in love with a local goon Ghonta.

title: ADG who was to probe May 11 riots transferred
keywords: Aurangabad news, Aurangabad latest news, Aurangabad news live, Aurangabad news today, Today news Aurangabad, Cop CM chose to probe May 11 riots transferred
content: Aurangabad: Additional director general of police (law & order) Bipin Bihari has been transferred within days of being tasked by the chief minister to probe the Aurangabad riots.With no clarity on who will carry out the high-level probe into last month’s communal violence, there are fears that it might meet the same fate as the Mitmita probe.Bihari, who was recently promoted to the rank of director general of police (DGP), has now been appointed as managing director of police housing and welfare corporation.During the last assembly session on March 15, chief minister Devendra Fadnavis sent the then commissioner of police Yashasvi Yadav on forced leave. He had also announced that DGP Satish Mathur and additional chief secretary (home) Sudhir Shrivastav would carry out the probe into the Mitmita violence. However, months after the announcement, the high-level committee is yet to reach Aurangabad for carrying out the probe.Sources said that following the routine procedure, a deputy commissioner of police rank officer has recorded the statements of Mitmita residents.In the recent Aurangabad riots, several videos purportedly showing police indulging in rioting or supporting the rioters surfaced, leaving the state home department as well as the DG office red-faced.Taking serious cognizance of the issue, Fadanvis on May 23 informed TOI that ADG L&O would carry out a probe into the riots that rocked the city on the night of May 11 and continued for over 12 hours.No clarification has been provided as to whether Bihari would continue the probe or if it would be the next additional director general of police (law & order) who will carry out the probe.Despite repetitive attempts, ACS (home) Sudhir Srivastav, DGP Mathur and DGP Bihari could not be reached for comment.Raising serious concerns over the pending probes, social activist and economist, professor HM Desarda said, “The recent violence is serious and a socially sensitive matter. The state government should have ensured a speedy probe. However, even days after the announcement, they seem to not even have begun the probe.”Desarda said the manner in which the probe into the violence is being delayed is not acceptable.
