title: CB-CID begins probe into riots, police firing
keywords: Madurai news, Madurai latest news, Madurai news live, Madurai news today, Today news Madurai, thoothukudi district police,south police station sources,South police,praveen kumar,Police firing,murali rambha,CRIME BRANCH,CB-CID begins probe into riots
content: Personnel from theCrime Branch– Crime Investigation Division (CB-CID) have begun preliminary inquiries into the riots andpolice firingthat claimed 13 lives in the city on May 22 and 23. Police sources said that theThoothukudi District Policehave registered cases against more than 16,500 people in five cases.Cases were registered against the rioters and public under 15 sections, including 11 sections of the Indian Penal Code. It is learnt that SIPCOT Police had registered a case against 10,000 people. TheSouth Policeregistered three cases against 6,000 persons while the North Police booked 500 people.These case files were handed over to a team led by CB-CID superintendent of policePraveen Kumar. On Thursday the team also retrieved CCTV footages recorded at the collectorate, ATMs and commercial establishments and in the centralised CCTV surveillance control room at the South Police Station.Sources said that they will begin a full-fledged inquiry after the bodies of the 13 victims who got killed in the incident are handed over to their families. The team comprising inspectors from across the state also plan to conduct inquiries with the public to get a clear picture of the protests and the riots that followed.Superintendent of Police (SP), of Thoothukudi District,Murali Rambhasaid that there were no major incidents of violence in the city from May 24. "Normalcy has returned to the city. There were not even stone pelting incidents in the city since then. There were stray incidents in the outskirts," he said and added that focus was to ensure peaceful handing over bodies of victims to their kin at the earliest.District Collector Sandeep Nanduri said that schools will reopen on Friday as usual as normalcy has returned. He also said that there has been no official communication on the arrival of the one-man commission or the national human rights commission to prove the incidents that took place on May 22 and 23. "We are ready to assist to them," he added.

title: Fajalpur violence: Mob booked for rioting
keywords: Vadodara news, Vadodara latest news, Vadodara news live, Vadodara news today, Today news Vadodara, vakhatsinh gohil,vakhatsinh,Nandesari,Fajalpur violence: Mob booked for rioting,fajalpur,dharmendrasinh gohil parvat gohil
content: VADODARA: A day after a mob set sand excavating machines and trucks on fire atFajalpurvillage near the city, a case of rioting was registered against three persons and a mob of around 50 to 60 people atNandesaripolice station.The mob had gone on a rampage on Tuesday morning after a sand truck carrying sand had mowed down 22-year-old Bharat Gohil, who lived in Fajalpur, near the village and worked as a contract worker at Gujarat Refinery.A complaint of rioting was given byVakhatsinh Gohil, who worked as caretaker at one of the sand mining sites.Vakhatsinhtold police that Bharat was knocked down by an unidentified truck near the village following which an angered mob led by Dharmendrasinh Gohil, Parvat Gohil and one Naren reached at the mining site.They told Vakhatsinh that the leaseholders are mining sand illegally and because of them trucks keep coming near the village. The mob then ransacked 11 sand excavating machines and trucks and set them on fire.The police have not arrested any accused in the rioting case nor in the road accident. Police said that they have not been able to identify the truck driver who knocked down Bharat nor they have learnt the registration number of the truck.

title: Another post-riots video clip surfaces
keywords: City News,City Latest News, News, Times Of India, Latest news
content: Aurangabad: In yet another post-riots video, the policemen are seen damaging parked vehicles, breaking glasses of an auto-rickshaw. The surfacing of video, depicting policemen in the bad light, has left the state police administration red-faced.However, the authorities with the city police, maintained that a majority of them appear to be the State Reserve Police Force jawans.Castigating the action, a deputy commissioner of police said, “A person who does not know as to who exactly has damaged his vehicle, would obviously feel that the rioters belonging to another community have damaged his vehicle, further fuelling the hatred. The forces deployed must have taken care of these sensitivities.”After the communal riots broke out on May 11, several companies of the SRPF were rushed to Aurangabad, from the two units of SRPF, namely group III of Jalna and Indian Reserve Battalion, group XIV.A senior police officer said, “During the recent riot bandobast, the green and dark blue helmets were used by the platoons and sections of SRPF Jalna. However, it will have be cross-checked if some others were also wearing helmets of these two colours.”The 71-second-long video that has been reportedly shot on the morning of May 12, from the gallery of a multi-storeyed house situated on the cross-road of Kaiser Colony, shows a group of policemen in green, dark blue and even khaki helmets moving on the deserted streets, while the situation appears to be peaceful.This is followed by a few policemen walking towards a road and one of them hits a bike parked on the roadside. Susbequently, the policemen go on rampage breaking every vehicle they could find on the roadside.The video though could not catch the policemen damaging other vehicles but the smashing of glasses could be heard till the end of the video.After going through the video, a police officer said, “Even during Bhima-Koregaon violence, the constabulary in different parts of the state faced allegations of damaging parked vehicles, bringing the entire police administration on the backfoot.”The authorities on Friday confirmed of receiving the video and maintained that it is being probed.Deputy commissioner of police (headquarter) Deepali Dhate Ghadge said, “We have received the video and have ordered a probe. Strict action would be taken against those who have committed the act.”

title: 26 riot victims undergo surgery for bullet injuries
keywords: Madurai news, Madurai latest news, Madurai news live, Madurai news today, Today news Madurai, tuticorin medical college and hospital,tuticorin kovilpatti srivaikuntam,tuticorin,tirunelveli medical college and hospital,Government Rajaji Hospital
content: TUTICORIN: Twenty-six riot victims who suffered bullet injuries and fractures underwent surgery inTuticorin Medical College and Hospitaltill Wednesday afternoon. “The condition of all is stable. We have brought 30 surgeons from various specialities from theTirunelveli Medical College and HospitalandGovernment Rajaji Hospital,” director of medical education (DME) A Edwin Joe told TOI.This is in addition to the 80 doctors from the hospital here and nearly 250 nurses and paramedics who have been dedicated to attend to riot victims.“Those who have been operated upon include those from whom bullets were retrieved and those who had suffered fractures,” he said and added that they have not taken stock of the number of persons who suffered bullet injuries as focus was to treat them.“The hospital is equipped to treat those who have been admitted and there is no need to refer them to private or other tertiary care government hospitals,” he added. One of the vehicles in which doctors were heading to the hospital was damaged in the stone pelting near the New bus stand. Luckily nobody was injured in the incident.He stated that nine persons were brought dead to the hospital till Wednesday afternoon.He added that only person who was critically injured, died in the hospital and that the condition of one more person who is being treated was critical. “The six surgery theatres in the hospital have been busy from 3 pm on Tuesday,” he said.He added that efforts were underway to fix issues of unavailability of food and water for the attendants of the patients.Edwin Joe said that four judicial magistrates – from Tuticorin, Kovilpatti, Srivaikuntam and Tiruchendur – were conducting inquest before post-mortem for those who were killed in the violence was conducted.

title: Those involved in communal riots will not be spared: CM Fadnavis
keywords: Aurangabad news, Aurangabad latest news, Aurangabad news live, Aurangabad news today, Today news Aurangabad, State Reserve Police Force,jaleel he,Imtiaz Jaleel,Devendra Fadnavis,Bipin Bihari
content: AURANGABAD: Chief ministerDevendra Fadnavishas ordered additional director general of police (law and order)Bipin Biharito conduct a probe into the violence and riot that rocked Aurangabad on May 11.Two people, including a teen, were killed in the violence and riots that broke out in Aurangabad on the night of May 11. Prohibitory orders had to be issued and internet services suspended for two days in the wake of the violence.State Reserve Police Forceteams had to be called in from adjoining districts to bring the situation under control.“No one involved in the violence will be spared, whoever it may be, irrespective of caste, religion or party,” Fadnavis told TOI. He added that the victims of the riot will be compensated as per norms.On Tuesday, Aurangabad police dissolved the special investigation team probing the riot within a week of its formation. A Shiv Sena and an MIM corporator have been arrested in the case.During the investigations, the team had come across videos of policemen shaking hands and accompanying the rioters, who torched properties and vehicles in the early hours of May 12.Speaking about the allegations against the Aurangabad police about their complicity with the rioters, Fadnavis, who heads the state home department, said strict action will be taken if any complacency is found in administrative action.Sources said that the CM took the decision to handover the probe to additional director general (law and order) Bipin Bihari after a group of MLAs from the state, including Aurangabad central MLAImtiaz Jaleel, made a representation to him late on Tuesday night.“Using crucial evidence collected from different parts of the city, we made a representation to the CM and brought the gravity of matter to his notice. He then assured of a high-level probe by an ADG rank officer and compensation to victims,” said Jaleel.He also informed that the CM has assured of appointing a full-time police commissioner in Aurangabad in the next three to five days.

title: No water, shelter for forces deployed in riot-hit Aurangabad
keywords: Aurangabad news, Aurangabad latest news, Aurangabad news live, Aurangabad news today, Today news Aurangabad, State Reserve Police Force,SRPF,Savarkar Chowk,nor shelter for SRPF men,Neither water
content: Men belonging to several companies of theState Reserve Police Force(SRPF) are being forced to sleep on the pavements with no place to rest at the makeshift control room.The men have been claiming that even water has not been arranged at their place of halt and it has become particularly difficult to manage considering the temperatures have consistently been hovering above 40 degrees celcius.An officer told TOI, “Though peace has been restored in the city and things have started returning to normalcy, a few hundred SRPF men have been kept on reserve for handling law and order situation, if any thing comes up.”As the Nizam-era building of the Aurangabad police commissionorate has been razed for the construction of a new building, several crucial branches and sections of the city police including police control room, economic offences wing, special branch, anti-terrorism cell, woman redressal cell and cybercrime branch have been shifted to a rented premise atSavarkar Chowk, which is about a couple of kilometres from the existing CP office.The remaining offices of the deputy commissioner of police (headquarter), crime branch, administration and back office too have been shifted to a rented building in the vicinity of CP office.As per the standard operating procedure, reserve police called in from across the state are to be accommodated in the vicinity of police control room, where adequate arrangements including place to rest have to be provided for them.On visiting the spot, ToI found the SRPF men sleeping along with stray dogs in the premises of the government library situated between Sillikhana and Savarkar Chowk. The additional force was also spotted sitting on the stairs of a showroom, sleeping under a tree, resting on the pavements and parked bikes. Their woes do not end here. These men are also forced to eat food on the roadside. These men are kept on reserve at the control room everyday from 7am to 10pm.These companies are part of the SRPF that was summoned to Aurangabad after communal violence brought the city to a halt on the night of May 11.Though an arrangement for accommodation has been made at a hostel of city-based college and the campus of the Indian Reserve Battalion in Satara area of the city, the reserve force is allowed go there only post 10pm daily.The senior police officers of the SRPF and the city police could not be reached for their comments.

title: Not just riot of colour, but key to ecosystem
keywords: Chennai news, Chennai latest news, Chennai news live, Chennai news today, Today news Chennai, Vellore,tamil nadu,Sathyamangalam Tiger Reserve,riot of colour,pollachi,ecosystem
content: CHENNAI: Think of butterflies and the mind paints a kaleidoscope of colours fluttering in a garden. But butterflies have more to them than just being a visual delight. They play the role of pollinators, balance the food chain and their behaviour, population and migration patterns help ecologists gauge the impact of environmental issues like climate change, deforestation and low rainfall.Keeping these aspects in mind, the state forest department has come out with a coffee table book titled ‘Butterflies of Tamil Nadu’. The book was released on Tuesday, coinciding with the International Day for Biological Diversity. The book documents 312 species of butterflies of the 323 species found inTamil Nadu. “The last book on butterflies was published in 2005 by Dr Guathilagaraj who documented only 90 species in south India,” says N Satheesh, conservator of forests.Satheesh says his team began research for the book two years ago. P Mohanprasath, a butterfly enthusiast and a photographer, has co-authored the book with Satheesh. As part of their research for the book, the team visited the forests in Coimbatore and Aanamalai Tiger Reserve inPollachi, a part of the Western Ghats as well as Amrithi forests inVelloreandSathyamangalam Tiger Reservein the Eastern Ghats besides visiting Srivilliputhur. “We identified around 32 butterfly hotspots where one can see at least 75 species,” Satheesh says.Around 32 species such as southern birdwing, malabar rose, Tamil catseye, Nilgiri clouded yellow, Nilgiri grass yellow and Malabar banded peacock are endemic to the Western Ghats. Rare species include orange owlet, yellow breasted flat, manytailed oakblue and Shiva sunbeam.“Butterflies are grouped into five families — Papilionidae, Pieridae, Numphalidae, Lycaenidae and Hesperidae. Many species use camouflage, mimicking and warning signals to escape predators. Species such as monarch and painted lady can travel long distances during their migratory period,” Satheesh says. “The wings of butterflies are made up of tiny scales which help them fly and are responsible for their colours,” he adds.The country’s diverse terrain, vegetation, climate and distinct seasons attract butterflies in large numbers. Satheesh, however, rues that environmental threats like pollution and pesticides are triggering a decline in the butterfly population. To fight it, the state has created a Tropical Butterfly Conservatory at Trichy, spread over 25 acres, and a butterfly park at Vandalur zoo. Satheesh says butterfly conservation will help in improving the environment in a big way. The book contains tips in this regard.Sensitising young children on butterfly conservation, watching butterflies regularly, starting butterfly gardens at home, school, workplace; educating farmers to use native seeds and shun pesticides; and participating in butterfly walks and surveys are a few ways through which common people can contribute their mite.Email your feedback to southpole.toi@timesgroup.com

title: Aurangabad riots: CM Devendra Fadnavis assures strict action against culprits
keywords: Aurangabad news, Aurangabad latest news, Aurangabad news live, Aurangabad news today, Today news Aurangabad, Varsha,samajwadi party,Fadnavis,congress the samajwadi party,adg
content: MUMBAI: Maharashtra Chief Minister DevendraFadnavison Wednesday said strict action will be taken against the guilty in the Aurangabad riots and that an Additional Director General (ADG)-level rank officer will probe the incident.A delegation of legislators from the Congress, theSamajwadi Partyand the MIM met Fadnavis last night to hand over the "proofs" of the alleged involvement of Shiv Sena workers and police personnel in the Aurangabad riots."I have assured the delegation that an inquiry will be conducted by an Additional Director General (law and order) and those involved in the incident will not be spared, irrespective of their caste, religion or party," the chief minister told PTI today.MIM MLAs Imtiyaz Jaleel and Waris Pathan, Congress' Amin Patel and Shaikh Asif, and Samajwadi Party legislator Abu Asim Azmi called on the CM at his official residence 'Varsha' around 11.30 pm yesterday to hand over the "proofs".Fadnavis said he also assured the MLAs that the innocents who suffered in the riots will be compensated as per the norms."Strict action will be taken if any complacency is found in the administrative action," Fadnavis said.MIM legislator Imtiyaz Jaleel said the chief minister also assured the delegation that a commissioner of police (CP) for Aurangabad will be announced within 72 hours.The state government had in March sent Yashasvi Yadav, who was then serving as the Aurangabad CP, on compulsory leave, over the police's "high-handedness" during the protest over dumping of garbage on the city's outskirts.Since then, Inspector General (IG) Milind Bharambe was handling the additional charge of Aurangabad.Jaleel said the delegation submitted a video evidence of "senior Sena leaders instigating the rioters and police officers remaining mute spectators.""We had demanded that an independent agency like the CID probe incident. However, the chief minister assured us that Nitin Bihari, the additional director general (law and order), and his team will conduct a thorough probe," he said.Two persons were killed and more than 60 injured in clashes between groups of two communities over illegal water connections in Aurangabad, about 350 km from Mumbai, on May 11.Around 100 shops were set on fire and more than 40 vehicles destroyed in the violence.

title: Akhilesh Yadav's hands have blood of Muzaffarnagar riots, says CM Yogi
keywords: Meerut news, Meerut latest news, Meerut news live, Meerut news today, Today news Meerut, Yogi Adityanath,Uttar Pradesh,samajwadi party,Saharanpur,Rashtriya Lok Dal,Akhilesh
content: AMBEHTA PEER (SAHARANPUR):Uttar Pradeshchief ministerYogi Adityanathon Tuesday lashed out at theSamajwadi Party(SP) and accused it of patronising criminals and communal forces when it was in power in the state. In a scathing dig at SP-BSP-RLD grand alliance, the CM said thatAkhileshYadav carries the blot of 2013 Muzaffarnagar riots, which occurred during his regime.Speaking at a poll rally in Saharanpur on Tuesday, Yogi Adityanath said, “Akhilesh Yadav might have loaned his candidate to the grand alliance but he has yet not come to Kairana to campaign. He has no moral courage to come here. He knows he carries the blot of Muzaffarnagar riots which happened during his regime. His hands are stained in blood of innocent people who were killed during Muzaffarnagar riots.”Apart from Yogi and deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya, several top leaders of the party, including Saharanpur MP Raghav Lakhanpal, Bareilly’s Aonla MP Dharmendra Kashyap, Rajya Sabha MP Kanta Kardam and battery of local MLAs were in attendance at the rally in Saharanpur’s Ambehta village in support of BJP's Kairana candidate Mriganka Singh.In another attack at Akhilesh Yadav, chief minister Yogi Aditynath compared the present law and order situation in the state to the one during the previous regime. “During the previous government, criminals used to chase the administration. BJP government broke this jinx. Now, the administration is chasing criminals and the latter are begging for life. Some are even running thela and khmocha (kiosk) to sustain their lives,” Yogi said.Stressing that his government had the poor and the marginalised at the centre of its policies, the CM also announced that the government was going to create three lakh jobs for the unemployed youth of the state.He said that for the welfare of farmers, the licence system for installing saw machine had been simplified and warned that people who exploit farmers would be sent to jail.The BJP leader said that his government would also ensure early and full payment of the cane growers’ arrears.Yogi is slated to address another rally in Shamli district on May 24.Voting for the Kairana parliamentary seat in western UP will be held on May 28. The seat was vacated following the death of senior BJP leader and incumbent MP Hukum Singh. The BJP has fielded his daughter Mriganka Singh, and Tabassum Hasan, who though is a SP member is fighting on aRashtriya Lok Dal(RLD) ticket.After the Gorakhpur and Phulpur experiments, where an alliance between the SP and the Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP), led to humiliating defeats for the ruling party, the SP, BSP, Congress, RLD and the Nishad Party have come together to back Hasan.

title: Landlords set shops on fire to settle old scores: Riot probe
keywords: Aurangabad news, Aurangabad latest news, Aurangabad news live, Aurangabad news today, Today news Aurangabad, shahgunj,Milind Bharambe,Landlords set shops on fire to settle old scores,fire,aurangabad
content: In a fresh twist to the recent communal violence, a high-level probe looking into the recent communal riots inAurangabadhas found that not all shops were burnt by rioters and that some were set alight due to property disputes.A few shops and properties that were not being vacated by tenants for decades were found to have been torched in an unusual manner, said sources in the police department.Most of these shops are situated in and aroundShahgunj, where property rates are higher than other areas of the city.When contacted, acting commissioner of policeMilind Bharambesaid, "We are probing the cases with that angle too."An assistant commissioner of police said witnesses' account of torching of such properties along with CCTV footage, if any, and technical evidence are being collected to establish the involvement of landlords or land sharks.

title: Riot video shows policemen shouting ‘communal’ abuses
keywords: Aurangabad news, Aurangabad latest news, Aurangabad news live, Aurangabad news today, Today news Aurangabad, State Reserve Police Force,Nawabpura,deepali dhate ghadge,aurangabad riot,aurangabad
content: AURANGABAD: Ten days afterAurangabadpolice ordered an inquiry into the role of cops in the communal riots that rocked the city on May 11 and 12 on the basis of a video, another clip showing policemen shouting “communallycharged” abuses surfaced on social media. The authenticity of the video, however, could not be independently verified.A 17-year-old boy and a senior citizen were killed while 60 people, including 31 police personnel were injured, in the communal violence in Aurangabad’s old city area. The new clip, a copy of which is with TOI, appears to have been shot from one of the houses inNawabpurain the early hours of May 12. It shows policemen firing from their self-loading rifles, abusing the residents of the area and then challenging them to come out of their houses.When contacted, SIT chief and deputy commissioner of police (headquarters)Deepali Dhate Ghadgesaid they are investigating the video and the accused would soon be identified.“It is very embarrassing that our policemen are found to be showering communal abuses and shielding the rioters. Whether complainants come forward or not, we will initiate action against the guilty policemen,” said a senior police officer. Residents of the area have alleged that several rounds were fired and several caps of empty cartridges were found on the road the day after. They added that fearing the threats, they remained indoors, while the rioters continued to torch their vehicles and property. The policemen later left the spot.The previous clip also hinted at cops’ complicity in the violence as if showed them accompanying rioters who were torching vehicles and property. When contacted, residents of the area alleged that the men were from the city police force not from theState Reserve Police Force.“These policemen caught on camera are the same men in the earlier video who were walking towards Jinsi. These men belong to the same group of policemen who, along with rioters, torched the vehicles and property in our area,” said a resident.

title: ​ Days before bypoll, Balyan rakes up Muzaffarnagar riots to target Grand Alliance
keywords: Meerut news, Meerut latest news, Meerut news live, Meerut news today, Today news Meerut, Tabassum Hasan,Sihi Kahi Chandru,Sanjeev Balyan,samajwadi party,meerut
content: MEERUT: In a strategic shift from the issue of development, BJP MPSanjeev Balyan, an accused in the 2013 Muzaffarnagar riots, on Sunday said that the grand alliance had made Azam Khan, a “key conspirator in riots”, as its start campaigner.Talking to TOI, Balyan claimed that he was “instigated” to raise the issue after a senior RLD leader blamed BJP for “masterminding the riots”.“A senior RLD leader had recently blamed BJP for the riots. He also claimed that if the grand alliance candidate,Tabassum Hasan, wins in Kairana, they will help in striking a compromise in riots cases involving Muslims,” the MP said.Meanwhile,Samajwadi Partyretaliated with another scathing attack. “Azam Khan hasn’t yet campaigned in Kairana. He never came here during the riots. All this hate mongering is unfounded. Balyan is himself an accused in riots cases,” Sanjay Lathar, SP’s in-charge for Kairana bypoll, said.Balyan, however, maintained that BJP has been projecting the revamped law and order situation to the public to seek their vote. “We have turned around things in Kairana. Law and order was a major issue and it has been addressed to a great extent. We are going to the people with this message,” he said.

title: Anasuya and Ali promise a laugh riot on Sixth Sense this week
keywords: star maa,sixth sense,Ohmkar,Anasuya,ali
content: The Telugu reality game show 'Sixth Sense' has emerged as one of the most-watched shows on primetime, and the makers are showing no intention of slowing down anytime soon. Hosted byOhmkar, who returned to television after directing 'Raju Gari Gadhi' series, 'Sixth Sense' pits celebrities against each other in a battle of the senses. After a power-packed show last week, with the likes of Namitha making an appearance on the show, this week promises to be equally entertaining with star anchorAnasuyaBharadwaj making an appearance on the show, along with from comedianAli.A promo released by the channel shows Anasuya and Ali dancing to party numbers before beginning the game show. Ali then find himself in a conundrum regarding whose advice to take as both Ohmkar and Anasuya tell him different things."This Weekend will be a fun blast with#Ali&@anusuyakhasbaon#SixthSense..This Sat & Sun at 9:30 PM on@StarMaa(sic)," the channel posted on its Twitter page, along with a promo from the show.Sixth Sense airs every Saturday and Sunday onStar Maaat 9:30 pm.

title: SRPF jawans deployed after riots struggle for water, shelter
keywords: Aurangabad news, Aurangabad latest news, Aurangabad news live, Aurangabad news today, Today news Aurangabad, Water,State Reserve Police Force,shelter,IRB,aurangabad
content: AURANGABAD: Several companies of theState Reserve Police Forcethat were called in from different parts of the state to help control the riots last week are facing a tough time in the city. The jawans are going without drinkingwater, mobile toilet facility as well as a proper place to take rest.When the riots broke out in the city, at least 10 companies of SRPF were summoned from Jalna,IRBAurangabad and others. Police officers said that their building can accommodate only 1-2 companies and they were making other facilities available for the remaining personnel.The SRPF jawans are complaining that Rs 52 is deducted daily from their salaries for providing them food prepared at the mess, while they get just Rs 100 as travelling allowance.They also complained that the district and city police inAurangabadare being relieved after eight hours of duty, while they continue to remain on duty for 24 hours. Several jawans were spotted sleeping on the roadside, in the police vans, pavements and verandas of religious structures.The SRPF vans have become the makeshift resting place for them. “As usual, we are depending on commoners to help us with basic things, including drinking water supply,” said one jawan.In the areas of Nawabpura, Champa Chowk, Raja Bazaar, Sansthan Ganpati and Kiran-Chawdi, where the shops remained closed after the riots, the jawans depended on the locals to get tea and water.Due to unavailability of mobile toilets and absence of public toilets in different parts of the city, the jawans are using washrooms available with the halls and religious places in the areas they have been posted.When contacted, DCP (headquarters) Deepali Dhate Ghadge said, “We have made arrangements for them (SRPF jawans) at hostels of colleges in the city. Our building is under construction and we have facilities to accommodate one or companies but not the entire platoon. We are taking care of the situation and trying to make things and facilities available for them.”As and when possible, the SRPF jawans were being sent to IRB for resting, said an official.

title: ‘Did he steal public money, orchestrate riots?’
keywords: Delhi news, Delhi latest news, Delhi news live, Delhi news today, Today news Delhi, subjected,questioning,questioned,public money,kejriwal,Fake encounters,CM,Anshu Prakash
content: NEW DELHI: After beingquestionedby a team of Delhi Police officers at his official residence for over three hours on Friday evening in connection with the alleged assault on Delhi’s chief secretaryAnshu Prakash, Chief Minister ArvindKejriwalon Friday described the case “false” and “politically motivated”. He said it was “unprecedented in the history of the country that aCMwassubjectedtoquestioningin a false case and a raid was conducted at his house”.The questioning elicited a strong reaction from AAP functionary Ashish Khetan who asked on Twitter what crime Kejriwal had committed. “What is his crime? Has he done a scam? Did he stealpublic money? Did he orderfake encounters? Did he orchestrate riots? Did he give bank loans to his cronies.” Khetan asked.Mounting another attack on the BJP’s Government at the Centre — whom the CM has accused of using the LG and Delhi Police for harassing AAP government’s functionaries — Kejriwal said in a statement he released on Twitter: “The work of the AAP government in education, health, power and other sectors has caused its popularity to grow very fast. The BJP-led Centre wants to stop the development work for which it has set the LG and the Delhi Police after us.”The chief minister thanked the cops who questioned him and promised that he will continue to cooperate with investigating agencies. “The questioning took place in a healthy atmosphere. I thank the police; there is no fault of the police because they are under huge pressure to lodge false cases,” he said, accusing the Centre of using the force to lodge many false cases against him, his ministers, AAP MLAs and also his relatives.“To harass and defame us is their (Centre) only motive. The people understand everything and they are with us. We will continue to serve the country till our last breath,” Kejriwal said. “One by one, all cases are collapsing in court and the remaining too will fall in court because all the cases are false and politically motivated.”The chief spokesperson of AAP in the capital, Saurabh Bharadwaj, said: “The police officers have accepted that they are being used as a tool. People understand this and are with AAP. We are not going to be afraid of this. We will fight till our last breath. We will win every time in the court.”

title: NDA government will render justice to those who suffered during anti-Sikh riots: Ram Madhav
keywords: India, India news, India news today, Today news, Google news, Breaking news, Sikh,Ram Madhav,NDA,Narendra Modi,BJP,anti-sikh riots
content: WASHINGTON: The BJP-ledNDAgovernment has taken steps and "will do its best" to render justice to each and every family that has suffered from the grave injustice perpetrated against them during the 1984anti-Sikh riots, a seniorBJPleader has said."I stand before you to assure the community that we will do our best to render justice to each and every family that has suffered during those unfortunate years," BJP general secretaryRam Madhavsaid amidst applause from the few hundred Sikh Americans who had gathered in a Maryland suburb of Washington DC to celebrate Vaisakhi.He said the NDA government has decided to go to any extent to punish the guilty in the crimes that were perpetrated against the Sikh community during 1984 riots.Justice Dhingra Commission is actively looking into 186 serious cases of crime against the Sikh community in 1984, he added. A number of FIRs have been filed again."In fact, arrest warrants have been issued against the leaders who were in the forefront of this whole crime against the community," he said.Prime MinisterNarendra Modiin a special message said that observing the Vaisakhi festival abroad is a glowing sign of the traditions and the values that the Sikh community continues to cherish."We are proud of the achievements of the Sikh community in North America, which has contributed significantly to the growth and prosperity in its adopted home. It is commendable that the community has also preserved its traditions and ethos, and is a living bridge with India," he said.Madhav also said that Indian-Americans are playing a pivotal role in building India's strategic ties with the US."We are not just political, strategic allies, we are natural allies because we are two people who share a very strong bond between us," he said."People of Indian origin who live in this country are an important pivot of this relationship. We value your contribution to strengthen this relationship," he said.

title: 1 killed, another hurt by Madhya Pradesh mob for ‘cow slaughter’
keywords: Bhopal news, Bhopal latest news, Bhopal news live, Bhopal news today, Today news Bhopal, tiwari,riots,Neeraj Sharma,Mob lynching,Madhya Pradesh,Bhopal
content: BHOPAL: One person was killed and another seriously injured after a lynch mob attacked them on suspicion of cow slaughter in Madhya Pradesh’s Satna district, police said on Saturday.Cops said the mob attacked Shiraz, 45, and his acquaintance, Shakeel, 35 late on Friday night.While Shiraz was killed on the spot, Shakeel was admitted to hospital, where his condition is said to be critical. “He is recuperating but he is not in a condition to give any statement,”Neeraj Sharma, manager of Metro Hospital in Jabalpur, told TOI.Cops have arrested four people — Pawan Singh, 35, Vijay Singh, 26, Phool Singh, 36, and Narayan Singh, 28 — for assaulting the two men. They were produced before a court on Saturday.Police have also booked the injured under cow slaughter prohibition Act merely on a verbal assessment by government doctor that the meat may be of beef. “All four were arrested and produced before court ,” said sub divisional officer Maihar ArvindTiwari, adding that Shakeel had named the accused before he was shifted to Jabalpur for treatment. “Beef and skeleton was recovered from the spot,” said Tiwari.On being asked whether the meant sample was sent for tests, Tiwari said it wasn’t. When asked how he concluded the seized meat was beef, Tiwari said, “Civil surgeon has confirmed it.It is after the confirmation that the injured was booked under cow slaughter prohibition Act”. A civil surgeon is a qualified MBBS doctor who treats humans, but is not an expert to identify meat. Laboratory tests should be done to ascertain whether it was beef or not, say experts.

title: Late cop's son held for rioting
keywords: Aurangabad news, Aurangabad latest news, Aurangabad news live, Aurangabad news today, Today news Aurangabad, Umesh,sansthan ganpati,rajabazaar,laxminarayan bakhriya,lachu pahelwan,cop's son held for rioting,Bipin Bihari
content: AURANGABAD: The son of a deceased assistant sub-inspector, who was reportedly trying for a job in the police department, was on Thursday arrested for his alleged role in vandalising and robbing a shop during the riots on the night of May 11.The suspect,UmeshAmbadas Lokhande (28), is employed with the personal loan department of a multi-national bank. His father was last posted at the City Chowk police station and died following a brief illness before his superannuation.Police sources said Umesh was vying for a job in the force on compassionate grounds, after his father died last year while still serving in the police department.Umesh was arrested on the basis of CCTV footage of the rioting and looting of shops in front ofSansthan Ganpati, the village deity situated in theRajabazaararea of the old city. The footage also shows two others accompanying him during the riot. Police are on their lookout.Police seized several articles, including gas stoves, small LPG cylinders, gas lamps from the residence of Umesh. His accomplices also reside in the Barudgarnala area, which falls under the limits of City Chowk police station.Interestingly, when senior inspector Ashok Modiraj reached the City Chowk police station along with the seized articles, he came to know that the police station had not yet registered an offence in that regard. Soon, a message was sent to the shop owner asking him to lodge his complaint."We have arrested the suspect, who turned out to be the son of a deceased policeman. We have seized the bike which was used to carry the articles home. We are looking for his accomplices, Ajay Ratnakar Nade and Vinod Janardan Bagul," Modiraj told TOI.When contacted, additional director general of police (law and order)Bipin Biharisaid, "Be it anybody, serious legal action would be initiated against the suspects against whom we get evidence."Main suspect in 5-day police custodyMeanwhile,Laxminarayan BakhriyaaliasLachu Pahelwan, who is the alleged main suspect in the riots, has been remanded in police custody for five days. He was arrested on Wednesday night from the Diwan Devdi area of the old city following a specific tip-off.The Special Investigation Team formed by police to investigate the violence, arrested Bakhriya for allegedly inciting the rioters.Deputy commissioner of police (zone-I) Vinayak Dhakne said, "There are allegations against Lachu Pahelwan for inciting communal violence and we have arrested him for the same."Along with Bakhriya, 11 suspects have been arrested on the charges of criminal conspiracy, unlawful assembly, rioting and torching properties. They have been slapped with sections of the Arms Act and sections of the Criminal Law Amendment Act, 1984.

title: Riots could have been prevented if cops were deployed earlier: Residents
keywords: City News,City Latest News, News, Times Of India, Latest news
content: Aurangabad: The residents of Gandhi Nagar and Motikaranja, where the first incident of stone-pelting and clashes took place late on Friday evening, are unhappy with police as they arrived about one-and-a-half hours late despite tension brewing in the area since afternoon.There was a clash between the residents of the areas over the snapping of illegal water connections to two religious structures earlier in the day, following which police had to intervene to bring the situation under control.Locals said that police should have deployed at least two constables in the area in view of the tension. “Had this been done, police would have come to know about the violence within minutes and the same could have been stopped from spiralling to other areas,” said one of the residents.According to the locals, the clashes started around 9 pm while police reached the spot only at 10.30 pm.As per the details accessed by TOI, the control room received the first call informing about the clashes at 10.22 pm, following which a message was passed on to area police stations, which sent teams to the spot.A senior police officer said, “The question is not about police’s response time to the distress call. One can imagine the extent of failure of police’s local intelligence gathering mechanism as the clashes continued for over 90 minutes before a private person called up the control room.”Anil Chordiye, an oil trader who has been running a shop in the area for almost two decades, said, “The incident around 9.15 pm — the time when I closed my shop for the day. Police reached the spot only around 10.30 pm.”He said that although three vehicles, each carrying three policemen, reached Motikaranja, hardly any of them took action against the mobs that were on the rampage.Echoing Chordiye’s views, his neighbour for two decades, Anwar Khan alias Mamu, said, “Had police reached the spot earlier and acted against the miscreants from both the sides, the communal violence would not have spread to neighbouring areas.”A resident of Gandhinagar said on the condition of anonymity that police reached the spot and parked their vehicles dividing the two areas. “Initially they did not act against the stone-pelters from both the sides.”Assistant commissioner of police Anita Jamadar, said, “As per the records, the first distress call informing about clashes was received by the control room at 10.22 pm, following which City Chowk as well as Kranti Chowk police stations were informed about it.”As per the call logs, City Chowk police inspector Hemant Kadam was the first to reach the spot, followed by assistant commissioner of police Govardhan Kolekar and Kranti Chowk inspector Shripad Paropkari. Within 15 minutes of these officers reaching the spot, serious stone-throwing started and a sharp stone hit ACP Kolekar, rupturing his throat and seriously injuring his windpipe.When contacted, DCP (headquarters) Deepali Dhate, head of the fact-finding SIT, said, “We are probing the exact cause of the incident, what time the violence started, who all are responsible, how it did spread to neighbouring areas, when did police learn about it and reach the spot and what was their response at the venue.”

title: Six arrested for rioting over petty argument
keywords: Vadodara news, Vadodara latest news, Vadodara news live, Vadodara news today, Today news Vadodara, Six arrested for rioting over petty argument,prahladsinh chavda,Mohsin,Latif,kausin tolat police,Amjad Salman
content: VADODARA: Six persons were arrested on Thursday in connection with clash between groups from two different communities in Waghodiya late on Wednesday night. Seven others involved in rioting were also booked at Waghodiya police station.The clash erupted after some persons from the two communities had petty arguments at a soda shop near Jai Ambe crossroads. One of the complainants Naitik Patel told police that when he and his two friends had gone to the soda shop owned byMohsin, they had arguments with the latter over cash change. When Patel’s friendPrahladsinh Chavdaoffered Rs 100 note, Mohin got angry and starting abusing them for giving change.Patel also alleged that three other persons – Amjad, Salman andLatif– who were sitting near Tolat’s shop too started hurling expletives at them. Later, they got into a fight which aggravated the situation. Within few minutes, large groups from both the communities gathered at the crossroads and resorted to heavy stone pelting. Some miscreants also threw glass bottles from the soda shop and some handcarts in the locality were also overturned.Those arrested include Amjad Pathan, Latif Pathan, Munaf Pathan, Salman Pathan, Mohsin Tolat and Kausin Tolat. Police said that they will be arresting more persons involved in the clash by Friday.During the melee, three persons got injured and they were rushed to a nearby private hospital. While Waghodiya police station team reached there to control the situation, additional force from neighbouring Dabhoi police station, local crime branch and special operations group were also deployed.

title: Shiv Sena, MIM corporators held for involvement in riots
keywords: Aurangabad news, Aurangabad latest news, Aurangabad news live, Aurangabad news today, Today news Aurangabad, shiv sena,1>In 4 Days’ Custody
content: Aurangabad: Two corporators — Rajendra Janjal ofShiv Senaand Feroz Moinuddin Khan of MIM — were arrested on Tuesday for their alleged role in the communal violence that rocked the city recently.A local court remanded both the corporators in four days of police custody.Janjal was allegedly found accompanying the rioters who torched properties and vehicles near Bharatiya Nursing Home on Friday night, police said, adding that there was proof of Khan's involvement too in the riots.Janjal, who represents the Shivajinagar area, initially resisted arrest while Khan, an elected member from Nawabpura area, surrendered before police. Nawabpura is one of the areas that suffered huge losses during the riots.Both the corporators were charged with committing mischief by fire or explosive substance with intent to destroy property.Police too have come under fire after video clips and CCTV footage showed some of their personnel accompanying the rioters who torched properties and vehicles but the officers remained tight-lipped about that.A team of senior police officers had gone to Khan’s house, but had to return empty handed as he was not there. Around the same time, deputy commissioner of police (zone-II) Rahul Shrirame, a couple of assistant commissioners of police and senior inspector Avinash Aghav, along with riot control police, reached Janjal’s house.Janjal’s supporters soon started gathering at his house followed by former Sena MLA Pradeep Jaiswal and Sena district president Ambadas Danve. They prevented police from arresting the corporator.It was only after deliberations lasting over an hour that Janjal agreed on the condition that he was not forced to sit in the police van. He reached Kranti Chowk police station, where he was formally arrested .Deputy commissioner of police (zone-I) Vinayak Dhakne said, “Based on the crucial evidences we have, both the corporators have been arrested. During the course of police custody, we will probe the involvement of the other suspects who assisted them.”Sources in the police department said that one of the suspects who was spotted torching properties and vehicles in the presence of policemen on the road from Raja Bazaar to Jinsi was arrested late on Monday night. He helped police in identifying the suspects, including Janjal, the sources added.

title: CIC on caste riot probe panel, can’t clear RTI cases: Activists
keywords: Mumbai news, Mumbai latest news, Mumbai news live, Mumbai news today, Today news Mumbai, Vijay Kumbhar,Shailesh Gandhi,RTI,Devendra Fadnavis,cic
content: MUMBAI: After the Chief Information Commissioner’s post lay vacant for a year, chief ministerDevendra Fadnavisrecently appointed veteran bureaucrat Sumit Mullick as the newCIC, but there are fears that he too may not be available for disposal of more than 5,000 pending appeals following his appointment on a judicial commission set up to probe the Bhima-Koregaon violence.Fadnavis had on February 9 set up a judicial commission under the Commission of Inquiry Act to probe the violence on January 1. While former Chief Justice JN Patel will preside over it, Mullick will be a member.RTIactivists have taken objection to the appointment of Mullick, saying he should quit the CIC assignment and take the job under the Commission of Inquiry Act.Ex-Central Information CommissionerShailesh Gandhicalled Mullick’s appointment untenable, unethical, bad in law and bad for the government. “I am shocked. There will be clear conflict of interest, since in the future questions on the Bhima-Koregaon probe may be raised before him in his capacity as CIC. In my opinion, in the larger public interest Mullick should give up one of the two posts,” Gandhi said.Pune-based RTI activistVijay Kumbharsaid the appointment of Mullick as member of the judicial commission was illegal. “Under provisions of law, a CIC cannot take up any other assignment as it’s a quasi-judicial assignment. If he continues as a member of the judicial commission, it will be a mockery of the landmark RTI Act,” Kumbhar said.Kumbhar said at a juncture when more than 36,000 appeals are pending across the state and 5,288 before the CIC, it was wrong on the part of Mullick to take up another assignment. “My information is that Mullick’s new assignment will be a full-time job, so he may not be able to devote time as CIC,” Kumbhar said.Mullick defended himself, saying he will ensure there is no injustice done to his role as CIC. “I will do justice to both assignments. I will sit for more hours and ensure that pending appeals under the RTI Act are disposed of in a time-bound mannter,” Mullick said.Justice Patel too defended his appointment, saying the commission’s work schedule has been drafted in such a way that CIC’s routine work will not be affected. “We will sit on Saturdays, Sundays and on public holidays. We will complete the probe in a time-bound manner,” Justice Patel said.

title: Initiate action against cops who suppressed intel info about riots: Munde
keywords: City News,City Latest News, News, Times Of India, Latest news
content: Aurangabad: Leader of Opposition in the state legislative council Dhananjay Munde, raising questions over the credibility of city police, on Tuesday demanded serious action against officers who intentionally suppressed intelligence information about the riots.The police are being criticised by different sections of the society for being a mute spectator during the riots that hit the city on Friday night. Munde has demanded judicial inquiry into the incident and appealed to the government to give Rs 25 lakh as compensation to the families of the deceased and Rs 2 lakh to the injured.Going a step ahead, Munde also demanded resignation of chief minister Devendra Fadnavis. “The police officers who suppressed the intelligence reports about the preparation of riots should not only face serious action, but also be suspended with immediate effect,” he said during his visit to the riot-hit areas of the old city.The Congress leader also claimed that the police had the intelligence information about the riots almost couple of months before it triggered on Friday.Munde said these were not riots between two communities, but basically violence triggered as one of the demands for extortion made by a sitting corporator’s kin were not being met by the traders, fruit merchants and vegetable hawkers.“It is indeed shameful that police just stood their ground and did nothing when the hooligans resorted to arson and stone pelting. The riot happened because of the ignorance of police,” he said,Criticizing the chief minister further, Munde said, “Why did he (Fadnavis) not visit Aurangabad? He sent the minister of state to take stock of the situation when he knows that MoS does not have any rights to take action.”

title: Can’t call riots communal: Top cop
keywords: City News,City Latest News, News, Times Of India, Latest news
content: Aurangabad: Acting city police commissioner Milind Bharambe on Friday said there is a silver lining to the recent riots as Hindu-Muslim unity came to the fore during and after the mayhem.The officer said members of both communities were flummoxed and rather stood by each other when anti-social elements went on the rampage“Although the riots are being dubbed as communal, we have observed that none of the minorities residing in the majority dominated areas or vice-versa have been harassed, targeted or assaulted,” the officer told reporters.Bharambe said that police have interacted with Hindus residing in Muslim-dominated areas and vice-versa and that members of both the communities said they stood by their neighbours, protecting their lives and properties to the extent possible.The officer said rumours about religious leaders being attacked by members of another community and women being targeted actually fuelled the riots.He did not rule out the role of miscreants with affiliation to different political parties in spreading such rumours.Meanwhile, the special investigation team (SIT), formed by police to probe the May 11 violence, is probing if the riots were pre-planned. An officer said, “We are yet to find strong evidence indicating that the riots were pre-planned. So far, it appears to be spontaneous action and reaction by groups.”The officer said that there is evidence that people from both the sides were prepared in whatever manner they could as they feared attacks.Sources said the SIT has found that the civic body has allegedly been carrying out frequent actions against a particular community, creating a feeling of victimisation, following which some people reportedly did some preparations for facing any untoward situation.An officer with the SIT said, “Some youths have revealed that they obtained sharp-edged weapons to face attacks in the wake of riots in the city.”The SIT is also probing as to why the special units and vehicles like Vajra, Varun and others were not used during the violence that was triggered by a dispute between the residents of Gandhi Nagar and Motikaranja over snapping of illegal water supply to a shrine.
